E1H_SdhH_jqTrmUA44rZjw.text: Muy delicioso! Taking up residence where JB's Restaurant used to be years and years ago, I was very excited to see that Los Reyes de la Torta would be expanding to Tempe! This restaurant serves up Mexico City cuisine, with various meaty options, some seafood (Shrimp) dishes, and a few vegetarian meals. We ventured in today, and were greeted with the buzz and bustle of a hectic opening week.   The interior is quite spacious, with warm, sunny colors and decor. There were a few people waiting in the front area for to-go orders, but we were seated promptly for sit-down service. Being my first time at a Los Reyes de la Torta location, I had to go with the Man vs. Food, Adam Richmond special: The famous Torta Del Rey ($9.50). I also tried some of the carne asada tacos.   We were served chips and salsa to start with. The salsa was thin, with good flavor and spicy heat. The torta was served sliced in half, with a large serving of crinkle-cut potato chips. It was a tall tower of meat, cheese, egg, and vegetables. When eating it, I was reminded of Adam Richmond's assessment of this sandwich on his "Best Sandwich in America" show. When you bite into the sandwich, you taste different layers of flavor and different temperature combinations depending on which section you bite into first (The sandwich is so big it's very hard to actually bite into all the layers at one time). The lower layer consists of a smattering of slow cooked beans and the roasted and breaded meats- the tastiest layer in my opinion! The middle section holds the cheese, scrambled egg, chorizo, and cured meats (Ham and hot dog). While I liked the ham and chorizo in the sandwich, the hot dog tended to overpower the other meats in the torta. The upper layer was the "cool" layer, consisting of sliced avocado and tomato. I enjoyed the combination of cool vegetables with grilled meat. However, I would have liked more of the cool ingredients to balance out all the hot ingredients. The torta itself was nicely grilled, with delicious telera bread.  The carne asada tacos were like street tacos. They had a good amount of chopped meat, cilantro, and onion on it, with some lime wedges to add more citrus flavor.  For beverages, they have a wide array of drinks to choose from (All non-alcoholic). I tried the horchata ($4), which was a little watery, but tasted freshly made and was pretty refreshing overall.  While I'm glad I tried the Torta Del Rey, it's a hefty meal. I'd definitely be interested in trying out more items from this restaurant!

j9vlEr99SW6nfx6GHWnn4g.text: I really like Mexican food, and its good here.  I very much enjoyed my chorizo burrito.  It was just right.  Beans, cheese, chorizo, and guacamole were in perfect ratio.  Ingredients were distributed throughout the burrito and not just clumped on there.  Nothing worse than taking a bite of your burrito and getting a mouthful of just guacamole! And none in the rest.  Yuck.  Not here, they know how to fix it right.  If I had to make a criticism, it would be the tough tortilla.  It was kind of difficult to cut-- but to their credit, they did provide a knife.  If you pick it up and eat it, stuff might squirt out and go everywhere when you bite through it.  I also enjoyed my husband's carne asada taco (I stole one off his plate).  Plenty of lime and yummy caramelized onion on the side.  Its worth a visit for sure.

PPSf_EXNqX3bU_g3Fbb-Bg.text: Delicious tortas, quick and friendly service, nice and clean location.  I'm holding on to the 5th star for now until I try more of the tortas. I may even have to dig into that Carlos V at some point if I work up a serious appetite one of these days. But this was quite a first experience and is easily a 4-star restaurant for me.  I came alone and was immediately seated. I was brought a basket of chips (kinda stale, not the greatest chips anyway) and salsa (nice and spicy, good flavor) to enjoy while I looked at the menu and waited for my entree.  The menu is extensive! There are a ton of different tortas to order (although I must admit that some of them seemed to be rather redundant), and there are other, non-tortas options as well. But with how delicious the tortas are, I'm not sure that I'll ever move on to the other options.  I ended up ordering El Principe with grilled chicken. It came out pretty quickly, and it was nice and hot. It was served with a small salad of lettuce, radishes, cucumbers, a charred chunk of onion, and a delicious broiled pepper. I dug into the salad and added some of the extra green salsa they brought with my sandwich. Then I dug into the sandwich. It was downright messy--grilled onions and chicken were falling all over my hands and plate. I added some salsa to several of the bites for some extra flavor, but it didn't need it. The chicken was nice and tender, the onions were soft and nicely charred, and the cheese, guacamole, and sauce all made for a great combination. The bolillo was very soft and tasty. All in all, this was an excellent sandwich!  The service was great throughout. I was acknowledged immediately when I walked in the door, even though the hostess had just left to seat somebody else. A guy in the kitchen saw me through the kitchen window and told me that somebody would be right with me. My server was very attentive and friendly as well.  I'll definitely be back, and if a few of the other tortas match this first one, I'll end up bumping my rating up to 5 stars.

KA2HbbjEA6NUeZIh_uKfHg.text: So it goes without saying (but I'll say it anyway), the tortas at LRDLT are enormous.  Like ridiculously large portions for the price.  The bread is soft.  They're piled super high.  The ham is sliced thick.  The breaded beef has a spicy kick to it.  The omelet (and yes... let's just call it an omelet) somehow makes it all come together.  And keep napkins nearby before you start because all the avocado and sauce and beans will get all over the place.  The tortas - I usually go with the Del Rey or the Reyna , just for the kitchen sink level variety of stuff they shove it.  Is it breakfast?  Is it lunch?  Is it dinner?  Yes!  All the tortas come with a more than generous side of Ruffles.  A few times when I've ordered a torta takeout, it's felt like they handed me a lunch sack with half a Costco-sized bag of them.  Service was solid and friendly although it's always been pretty busy every time I've been here.  Wait times go by fast though.  And now, I can't wait for my next visit.

_7ooDWwg3o2zjAmOPu4slg.text: Real authentic Mexican food! I read a few reviews and as a Mexican American brought up eating Mexican food; I have to say by far this place takes the win over most restaurants I've been to.  Deliciososo!

rOWnYQEzEc9I6GfxKRAGNg.text: Oh tortas, I didn't know what you were but I'm glad I finally decided to try you. I always get the Arizona. How can you go wrong with an egg on top of breaded beef, with a handful of other delicious ingredients thrown in? I don't think I would venture out to eat anything but their tortas.   The service is pretty prompt. I never had an empty glass, or an empty chip bowl. Speaking of chips, they are pretty good. A little saltier than I'm used to, but still good enough to have an empty bowl by the time the food comes. The salsa could be better... I don't know how to explain the salsa other than really bland. It's not always this way, but this visit was definitely a miss.   I also like their Strawberry milkshake. It's served in a large goblet looking cup, for almost $5 the price is just right. I could just have that as a meal. Check out their desserts and large drink selection (fresh fruit drinks).   Come eat some tortas! It is also good enough to be on food network (Man Vs Food - even though I dislike this show they advertise it, and Diners, drive ins and dives).

Wl4GCwz7CYuTtypCKKSZjg.text: This place is a lot bigger, nicer, cleaner than the original Cave Creek location with better decor.  The food is the same as the original location, very authentic, delicious and big tortas.  Actually, everything is done big!  The enchiladas, with fresh made tortillas, the quesadillas, the drinks...even the tacos have a lot of meat.  So yummy.  My favorite is the pina colada drink and all the other fruity drinks.  This food is expensive though, so we only go as a family treat.  Otherwise, your local Mexican restaurant or Ranch Market will give you the same for cheaper.  Also, Thursdays kids eat free.

They just give you a total, you don`t even know what are you paying for, because you just get the total of what you consume they can charge you more and you don`t even know and I think this is against the consumers law because the customer have to know what they are paying for otherwise any business can rip you off your money and charge whatever they want.I never went to a restaurant that did not give the customer the list of what it consumed with the price.

LpfsdXa_Gid-tlA4FhPKWQ.text: I can't believe all the nay-sayers I see posting here.  So I had to update my review to answer a few "disputes" listed by the rather clueless individuals posting hereto.  1.)  Their Carne Asada is made from TOP SIRLOIN.  NO RESTAURANT in the WORLD (except Los Reyes) makes their Carne Asada from top sirloin.  So for those who say that their meat is "garbage" or "old"--think again.  2.)  Frozen rice?  Everything here is hand-made.  Not reconstituted.  They don't have "frozen rice."  3.)  Crappy frijoles?  These are made from scratch.  If you think they aren't "up to par" with other AZ offerings . . . I know FIRST HAND that most of the "Mexican" restaurants here in the Valley reconstitute their "frijoles" from a powdered mix with boiling water.  If you prefer the taste of that crap . . . then, of course, you have no clue as to how real frijoles are prepared en Mexico.  Much like people who turn their noses up at Prime Rib because it doesn't taste like a McDonald's hamburger.  4.)  This is real-deal cooking from D.F.  If you don't know what that means, you probably need to do a little traveling.  If it doesn't match the "Tex-Mex" or burrito/chimichanga fare you are used to (PS:  neither of those are Mexican dishes--they were invented in El Paso, TX, USA around 1912) then don't decry them based on your lack of experience.  Try actually going to Southern Mexico--ask for a Burrito and they'll laugh in your face; ask for a chimichanga and they'll look at you in confusion.  Most Mexican nationals have NEVER SEEN A BURRITO UNLESS THEY HAVE VACATIONED IN THE UNITED STATES.  Mexico's regional cooking is very diverse . . . much like you won't see a Hot Brown outside of Kentucky or Mud Pie outside of Mississippi, but they are BOTH American dishes.  So don't judge if you don't know.  5.)  Not spicy enough, therefore not authentic?  That's how it is in most mainstream D.F. restaurants.  The "heat" that people search out here in the SW USA and then "credit" to Mexico is actually not how it is in real life.  And, believe me, I actually do know this from experience, having traveled most of Central & Southern Mexico on the economy, NOT on resort tours.  If you don't like the food . . . well that's certainly your prerogative.  But don't decry LRDLT's efforts and expertise based on your complete lack of knowledge/experience of REAL Mexican cuisine.  And don't compare them to Tex-Mex or "gringo-ized" offerings you get here in the US.

GNEmzCLrDwa0fJuzdAxpew.text: First time here and the food was great! The people were very nice and the ambience is nice to relax and catch your breath. Although our server was a little slow because they were very busy with all the people coming in. Overall I give it 5 stars, amazing food!

D4J7bst4Ktm-mBT4pOj8-A.text: This location of Los Reyes is a bit run down and has a noticeable sewage-like smell, which sets a poor tone for your meal.  Once you get used to that you will find yourself in what is essentially a diner with a Mexican menu.  The tortas (sandwiches) for which they are named are okay, but the ingredients are not quality.  The ham slice which is on almost every torta is a slice of pressed ham pieces that could have come out of a can.  The breaded beef is a wafer thin slice of beef encrusted in soggy breading.  And the roll is shaped like a bolillo but is soft and crustless, although it is grilled to give it a bit of crisp.  It's not horrible, but it's not tasty either.    They could do a lot better.

My order had modifications and he repeated everything back to me to assure it was correct. He checked on us in a timely manner, and even shook our hands to say goodbye.   The food was also amazing. I've heard such good things from the other locations and saw them on man vs food.  Unfortunately like a lot of other reviewers I found the service to be sub par.  The waitress did not know many very basic questions about the menu.  I'm OK with a learning curve with this being a new restaurant but everything I asked she had to go ask someone else about.  It didn't seem she knew much about the menu.  I also felt their was a language gap as her English phrasing came across harsh and rude.  If I knew Spanish I feel the entire experience might have been better.  The food came in a reasonable amount of time and everyone enjoyed their meal.  The price was very reasonable.  Overall my only complaint was the service but I'll give them some time to iron out the service and I will come back again.

The manager wouldn't even offer a discount or a freakin apology!  Last time I go there. I wouldn't recommend this location. Unless you want crappy service.

wjltSJHrM78a_l9LTE9erA.text: This was a tough review.  They advertise Mexico City cuisine, to me it was pretty much Sonoran. The food was very tasty, I had a torta where the bread was dipped in a guarillo sauce. The problem with it was that it was all bread with very little filling, but I still loved the flavors.  The place is pretty big with not much crowd. I hope they make it. They would probably have been better off in a smaller establishment.

lcpGXvvOhYD3spRooTQlTA.text: I have mixed feelings for Los Reyes de la Torta.  A craving after seeing the mouth-watering Man vs. Food episode sent me to the restaurant.  While my stomach wasn't ready for the infamous torta, I tried a meat combo plate.  What were labeled as "sausages" were sliced hot dogs, and the ham was essentially thin sandwich meat heated on a grill.  On a positive note, the guacamole and salsas are delicious and worth trying which gives the extra star.  I plan on going back to the restaurant to try the Torta del Rey and hopefully increase the rating.

U2YHTGCpmNP-oYOoHq3aLA.text: I had high hopes for this restaurant. The old J.B.'s building had been unoccupied for years and I was excited to see a new restaurant going in, particularly one that didn't seem to be part of a mega-chain, 'cause, really, how many Applebee's and Outbacks and Joe's Crab Shacks do we need within a ten-square-mile radius of my home? A few weeks after the "grand opening" traffic died down, I popped in with my boyfriend and my mother for a quick lunch.  We won't be back.  The service was dreadful, from the hostess who rolled her eyes and said, "Come on" as she grabbed menus and headed to a table (Really? What happened to "Right this way" or "Follow me, please") to the completely nonverbal waitress who seemed unable to do anything but point and grunt. She did her job, but it was very perfunctory. She did not say ONE word to us the entire hour or so we were there. She would bring the water pitcher to our table, lift it, and go "Unuh?" What? We are bilingual, and also tried to communicate in Spanish to no avail, so at some point we just quit trying. (It did occur to me that maybe she had laryngitis, or was mentally challenged or something, but in my experience, in those cases, the hostess or manager will take 20 seconds to let you know, so I think she was just a very inexperienced server or a horrifically rude person.)  Very stale chips, bland salsa that was obviously on the cusp of going "off"...you know that weird overripe tomato taste. It was the first time I've EVER been in a Mexican restaurant and not polished off at least one serving of chips and salsa.   I understand the fare here is supposed to be "Mexico City" or "Central Mexico" or whatever but the food was just not to my liking. There were few vegetarian options, and with a waitress who couldn't talk, I was unable to ask my usual (very few and very polite) questions about whether or not the chips were fried in lard, or if the sauce was made with chicken stock. I settled on a "Don't ask, don't tell" policy and ordered some sort of veggie burrito. Nothing to write home about, but edible. The onions were cooked nicely. My mother, also a vegetarian, got stuck eating the same thing. There are some "you can order mushrooms instead of meat" dealies, but with no way to figure out how they were prepared, I didn't want to go that route, and neither did my mother. My boyfriend ordered some sort of meat taco nonsense which he did not enjoy and did not finish. He said the meat was underseasoned and overcooked.  The dessert menu looked interesting, so we decided to split some sort of chocolate flan cake thingy. It was yummy, but obviously a frozen product.   Bottom line...if you're stuck there with some work friends, you can probably find something mildly edible. If you're into this "style" of cooking (I'm not sure that authentic Central Mexican cuisine consists of stale chips, rotting salsa, and burned meat, but okay) you'll probably enjoy Los Reyes. If you want to have a really good meal with super-friendly service, drive a little further (or flip a U-ey) and hit up Sahara on the NE corner of McClintock and Southern.

xI3_mBgWxbt8Bmz7JvbCZQ.text: real Mexican food, price moderated, clean and neat atmosphere, service excellent, well deserved review

kpKleUkeAs4JB1Ic4whcpA.text: First time here.  Receive wrong food. The check is handwritten can't tell what you are being charged for. The corn quesidalla be careful with  add on will more than double in Price. Food was dry. We received the wrong food at first. It was an unpleasant experience.

They serve menudo on the weekends & every friend I have recommended to go there has enjoyed it. Just wish they would buy a liquor license but the virgin drinks are still good. (:

LKV8OE2EtQfdi_Io1XUdeg.text: My go-to place when I'm craving a torta. So glad I don't have to drive to north Phoenix anymore!

o9yaDmSc5zdzKCH-pqmVCQ.text: We had dinner here last Saturday with our son and grandson.  My husband and I each had one of the Quesadillas de Maiz which is on the appetizer menu.  This is made with a huge and thick corn tortilla, filled with meat and sauce, topped with more sauce and crema and it's very tasty. We took half of it home for lunch the next day.  It cost only $5.50.  Our son had the Torta Norteno.  We learned that Tortas are basically sandwiches served on Hogie type bun.  The bun is very tasty. The grandson had the Torta del Rey which has a crazy list of things in it like ham, pork sirloin, beef, an omelet---and on and on.  These sandwiches are so big that half of them went home for the next day. We ordered the Tres Leches cake for dessert.  The presentation on that rivaled any fancy place you might eat at.  And it was delicious! The service was excellent.  If only all restaurants had this quality of service.      They serve only non-alcoholic beverages but they have Margaritas and Pina Coladas.  You just have to bring your own bottle.        When you walk in you will see TV monitors on Spanish speaking channels and hear lots of Spanish but don't be put off by this, our waitress spoke perfect English.     We'll go there again soon.

DnIsC5q30OvOpX2JWxL5Hg.text: Really good Mexican food! Will be coming back for sure. I tried the ceviche this time and it was fantastic. This place will not disappoint. The service is always great!

hwxthUhbLgMoJDuLp_kicQ.text: Ok so before I moved to Tempe I had seen this place on the ever so awesome show Man Vs Food as well as America's best sandwiches. Of course I had to go here and try it right?! When we sat down and got the menu I saw that this place was more than just Tortas (Mexican style sandwiches). They had a very extensive menu. Oh man what the heck was I going to order with so many choices. I'm not a decisive person so when i get a huge menu it makes it really hard on me. Ugghhh! But wait this place has Torta in their name and every time I had seen them on TV it was a Torta the foodie celeb was eating so that was what I would order as well! I wasnt about to try the Man vs Food Torta called the Torta King Carlos V priced at over $20, but this is because it can feed a small village. Nope not for me. I would instead choose the other sandwich which came out in America's best sandwich list...the Torta Del Rey. The sandwich consisted of the following: Ham, melted cheese, pork sirloin, breaded beef, omelet, sausage and Mexican sausage come with tomato, onions, avocado, chipotle sauce, smear of refried beans and potatoes ruffles on the side. That sounds like a lot yumminess in between 2 pieces of bread. Wait how do they even fit all of that in a sandwich? They're joking right...Not at all! This thing is huge and just under $10...oh my! Whoever thought of this is a genius cause it tasted amazing! The only downfall is the thing is huge and hard to keep together. Gets quite messy for sure, but the experience is pleasurable throughout. Last of all the service was incredible. The host and waitresses would promptly come around frequently always making sure we were content. I would definitely return here and suggest anyone else do the same...just make sure you are feeling hungry!

8ML4HEWMNucrtOZ-AjRcRA.text: So amazing! I grew up on my grandmother's authentic Mexican food, and this is a close second. We have been here multiple times and every time it's delicious and staff is friendly. Free chips and delicious homemade salsa. Will definitely be back, again and again.

cni1bDLcj9_3O-L5wHcMEA.text: First time visiting this place. It was recommended by a cousin of mine who is an AZ native. This place had several reviews raving about the Mexican food that was offered here. The inside is very Mexican like. A lot of good Mexican music being played as well as the decor. The menu had a variety of things to choose from. How can you come to a torta place and not order a torta??? I ordered El Principe. It came with beans, pico de gallo, salsa, Mexican cheese, choice of meat (beef) jalapenos and some lettuce. It was really good!! Everything from the flavor to the portion size was on point. This place was definitely a highlight of my day. I would recommend coming especially since the guy from Man vs Food came here in 2012. Check it out!! You won't be disappointed.

eEBCtLzuRPZcH6YCbTfjTg.text: Walking into the place was like walking into a little bit of Mexico. Mexican pop salsa music was quietly playing and the TVs were turned to Fox deportes channel. The cushions were Naugahyde and the table tops were clean but with a thin film of stickiness. Probably grease. Loved it. Nice, pleasant, unpretentious surroundings and people. Hope you're hungry. Big big portions that should satisfy the biggest eaters. Not expensive. Large menu. Bewildering if you don't know Mexican cuisine. Authentic. I've never tasted prickly pear before. Lots of cheeses in our meals so watch out lactose intolerants. Interesting flavors and textures. Will definitely come back when I want to feel like I'm briefly visiting Mexico for a meal.

ZlpFdNqVcIGadG7JX5gMzg.text: Just picked up a to go order. Fast and delicious. I had the green chile enchiladas, my kids had the chicken with rice and beans and the steak rice and beans kids plate. We all gobbled it up. So good. We will be back.

KIKOEv0ne_RTeXIEHmkrvA.text: I've been to the first location several times. People complained there about the building, the lack of ventilation and all that. Here they don't have those issues as the building is very large and open.   The food is great, not as good as I remember the same food being at the other location but I wasn't as hungry this time either so it may have just been me.   This place gave us tortilla chips and hot sauce when we sat down. I jokingly asked my wife where the potato chips were like we had at the other location. Later when I got my torta I got my potato chips and laughed about it. The guacamole was good but spicy. Most other places don't have spicy guacamole. So remember if the hot sauce is too hot eating guacamole to cool down your mouth will just make it worse.   The place wasn't very busy and the waitress was very nice and attentive. The food came quickly and you could tell was freshly made. I'll be back as this location is much closer to work and home.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. ¡La Torta Del Rey! The King&#39;s Sandwich!

OiE9G6lsynzr7pEFsVaptA.text: Mexico City food rather than typical Arizona Mexican food. FRESH food, variety of choices, large portions, reasonable prices. Restaurant is immaculate and every staff member greets you! Our waiter, Tony, was excellent. We will return to try this more authentic Mexican food.

FqsDW6Rt59odnH5Suu16tg.text: This place is awesome and absolutely delicious!  Tonight we stopped in to have valentine's dinner they had the place decorated with lotts of love for Valentine's day. Our waitress Alondra was very quick kind and professional. Every few minutes she constantly asked if we needed anything and that to us is very important. I enjoyed the cheese enchiladas with rice and had to order beans on the side.  It was prepared differently than most mexican food places. It had mozzarella cheese inside on top it had lettice, avocado, mexican cheese and sour cream topped with home made  green verde salsa. I can tell it wasn't a frozen food its authentic.  They also have a very large selection of natural fruit drinks check out my photos of what drinks they have. Especially if your pregnant they have alot of delicious healthy drinks. Im definitely coming back to this place love the great customer service and how they make the food makes me wonder if this is how  people in Mexico prepare their food because its slightly different than filibertos, ponchos and so on. The restaurant is very clean and  nice.

Qie94aSUkDlt8lOftZWYlw.text: This was my go-to spot for Tortas with my boyfriend when I lived on this part of town.   The service is always so friendly every time we have been here. They give you chips and salsa immediately and keep your water topped off.   I've tried a bunch of their different tortas, but tend to get the "mini" tortas since I can't eat that much. You get plenty of food for the money you pay, and it's quite yummy!   I recommend this place if you're in the area!

ZQPhNTZcgTg93Qoq5-yhrw.text: Love the food!  Always hot and fresh! Love the hospitality!  The staff is ALWAYS friendly and attentive to our needs!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

IU8uZpRYO9l4-4ZexPYj3A.text: After a trip to the Goodwill in this same parking lot, my tummy starts rumbling for lunch. It is 10:10am and my 4am breakfast is long gone. I look around and see a neon "Open" sign glowing from across the parking lot. The sign on the door says they open at 10am, so I hustle in and am immediately seated in a booth.   A basket of tortilla chips and a small bowl of salsa instantly appear and a smiling waitress takes my order promptly. I order a small chicken torta (less than $6). The chips were odd. Some tasted stale and like unsalted Fritos. Others tasted like over salted fresh tortilla shells. The salsa was watery and not to my taste. I can't quite put my finger on what was missing in it, but it tasted like tomato juice.   My torta arrived steaming hot with a side of potato chips. It seemed like carb overkill--tortilla chips, potato chips, and the bread in the sandwich. That said, I loved the toasted roll and the chicken. The tomato on the sandwich was pale with no taste.   The decor here is strange. I know that they have tried to turn an old JBs into a Mexican vibe eating place, but the painted walls were really bugging me. About half way through my sandwich I figured it out. They tried to make the walls in the dining area look like they had been stuccoed, but instead it looks like a bunch of 3 year olds had finger painted the wall with poo. Yech. Two walls had flat screen TVs on them, but with no volume and on different stations. Just as they were bringing my sandwich, someone switched on some Mexican polka music so loud that it startled me.   Would I eat here again. Probably not. If someone was just craving a torta would I mention this place? Yes, but only because I don't know of many torta places nearby.

lOWjwmX9wTjh_vobTvcmtw.text: I visited a handful of times and have thoroughly enjoyed everything I've got. The tortas and tasty as well and the burritos, tacos, chips and salsa. The ceviche was also a highlight for my wife and I. Complimentary chips and salsa are always welcome. The staff is friendly and service is responsive. The dining room is clean and there are a few tvs with sports on that I enjoy. This plac will definitely leaving you wanting to return to try more and more menu items. I know I'll be back again.

V6YTRMbqScATXKtQyoSKXQ.text: Have eaten at this place before and was quite satisfied, but this time the food was not as tasty as before.  Not sure if it was that it had to be delivered, which meant it was not hit and right out of the kitchen, but it was just different.  Will try again and hope to get a better result.

-5enBliRPXfuEmYrUfzkSg.text: The closest I've tasted to real Mexican food! The food is really good!! I have been there twice and it's been 2 great experiences. Definitely give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Torta del rey. MMMMmmm!

gxoIQkcHmGg8JnptQxdtaw.text: This is the perfect lunch spot -great service, delicious food and (virgin) drinks, and food comes quick!  This place is walking distance from my apartment and I've been hearing how tasty it  is for a while. My boyfriend and I finally decided to go last week. We were served tortilla chips and fresh salsa when we arrived and I ordered a watermelon agua fresca. It came out quickly and was so delicious. It's a perfect refreshing drink for a hot summer day.  I ordered the nortena de pollo and it was awesome! The bread is warm, light, soft with a light crunch. The chicken, cheese, and toppings were great! I loved it!  My boyfriend ordered the del principe with steak. It has basically the same ingredients as the nortena de pollo but with a thick slice of cold Mexican cheese. He wasn't a huge fan of the cold cheese on the warm torta, but I thought it was tasty. For newbies to authentic Mexican food, just realize the Mexican cheese will be a cold thick slice and the melted cheese is obviously warm and melted.   We definitely plan on coming back and trying more tortas. Check this place out

23nizxGTGcB5nLnxeN7fPw.text: Love Los Reyes de La Torta! Great place to visit in Arizona! Food are huge and delicious! Waters are yummy and natural ... my Dominican friends loved it! Can wait to comeback to Phoenix and eat there !

diuOx0jDH9siIN9FP9DOdQ.text: Omg im obsessed with their food. The king tacos de res are insanely delicious. Also the huevos divorciados are to die for. Reminds me of my vacations in Mexico, come here for great food!!

SykllMwAjwXz9sGobZbyKw.text: Yum!  Yumm!  Yummm!  If your looking for healthy you shouldn't be shopping for Mexican food.  Cheesy hot deliciousness is what you'll find here.  There is such a huge variety of tortas to choose from that its very overwhelming.  I had to go with the waitresses recommendation and so glad I did.  I ordered the princess and think its called that cause its a bit more dainty than some of the other selections.  It was amazing.  I normally cannot finish a whole sandwich but it was so good, I could not stop eating it.  One of those oh, one more bite scenarios and felt like they had to roll me outta there.   Great place, you have to experience it for yourself!

hdaE2l4rdTIIO7XHJ2-waQ.text: So many options it's hard to make a choice. Good choices though.  I ordered the tacos, figured for a first time trying the basic I cant go wrong...and I wasnt, they were really good, authentic and filling. My son tried the torta ahogada...it was huge. But hes a boy and was able to finish that. Free chips and salsa.  New Mexican fave place

BhstUdF9k1vasNVdHdsRbg.text: Unfortunately our lunch here was a disappointment.  My husband ordered shrimp tacos and ordered the King Tacos with chicken. Both our meals were cold and I took a bite of mine and it was steak instead of chicken and grisly steak at that. I waited for our waitress to come over and when she didn't I ate the rice. The waitress finally came over and my husband said his meal was cold and i explained I ordered chicken which she said I hadn't.  Explained I didn't want the steak and sent it back. She did offer to get me something else but at this point I was more dumbfounded by the lack of initiative to replace my husbands cold meal and my incorrect one. When the bill came my husband saw my meal was still on it and he asked why she didn't remove mine and she just looked at us. This was very disappointing and I just wanted to leave.

1V7LNr6NAvdRlLtW8zd1PQ.text: Place is really good. The quesadillas are Mexico City style- 12inch corn tortilla. I got the shrimp alambre and a potato and chorizo as well. The flan is also really good! This place also allows you to bring your own alcohol since they don't serve any there.

QP5GKR2EwWqGCyn1Lcifug.text: Food was just ok. Chicken tacos decent flavor but super greasy. Quesadilla was more like an enchilada covered in green sauce. Agua frescas were blended fruit smoothies, not fruit waters. No alcohol is served. Place was packed with people waiting, I do not understand why!

IM1KoSH_jgxYxNXy9FUDHw.text: Los Reyes De La Torta is excelente! Did i say that right?  This hidden gem always gets good reviews from my friend and now I can see why. The staff is pretty friendly and the atmosphere feels festive. We were interested to come here because Guy Fieri also gave his stamp of approval.  The menu has tortas, lots of appetizers and colorful drinks. I ordered a horchata that came out in a HUGE goblet. Our friends pina Colada had a umbrella in the drink like it was his bday!  I enjoyed the shrimp appetizer it was really fresh! It was a small bite the only gripe is I wish I could have more!   Our large torta sandwich came and we shared. Guys with big appetites will enjoy this this place because they are very generous with portion sizes.  We'll be back for sure!

SM-xqht_XATuMry0FEx0AQ.text: This place is amazing. Nothing beats the quality and flavor of the Mexican food they provide here. They are the Best in the Valley! Great place to take your family, have a birthday dinner or take out. I love their corn quesadillas, tacos, their tortas, their pambazos, their Rico burrito de chorizo. _qAao9ztAsrDKrWyms8OoA.text: I have visited this restaurant several times and it always rocks from start to finish. Friendly, courteous staff to welcome and serve you. Every dish I've had from  appetizers to  entrees and desserts have always been delicious.   Another great thing about this place is the prices are exceptionally fair for value received.

CVK2LRR1Qshn15xacYPeRw.text: Passed by this place many times but never gone in. My Spanish skills that day was rusty, The pictures of the food does indeed match the menu when you get your plate. I ended up getting the Arizona Torta, even though I wanted to leave the pork items off, they were able to accommodate me,( no problemo). It was beautifully presented, the bolillo bread was very fresh it was all good, so much so I had to take the rest home. Good for kids and first dates, especially if you like the local music as ambiance, I found myself dancing a bit while seated in my booth, but the waitataff didn't mind

nNKCma0XBO8p6EyDl5byTQ.text: I ate here a couple of years ago and I was SO GOOD!!!! tonight we were in the area, so we stopped here about a hr and a half to closing time. WOSRT MISTAKE EVER!!!!!!! I ordered  3 green enchiladas, and they gave me 3 fried tacos with enchilada sauce on it, the chicken tasted old and disgusting! I also ordered a side of refried beans and that also was nasty, it tasted like they used a month old oil! totally disgusted with this place will not be going here again.

BjEwolSrmqCI_9glVZmAog.text: Great food. Jalapenos are on everything tho, so if you're sensitive, be sure to request without.  ***Would not recommend Grubhub delivery. They took over an hour & food was all room temp when it arrived. We reheated everything, and i bet it's much better when consumed freshly prepared :(

yXU1mEkzYzq4z9OvgdzwoA.text: This is a very, very good Mexican restaurant, with plenty of traditional options on its extensive menu. The huaraches con nopales were excellent, as was the michelada I ordered.  The tortas, which my son tried, were also very good. The prensado was juicy, and very flavorful.   Definitely a place I will try again, hopefully soon!

EEo6zNt_hSoSf8nbBrGlfQ.text: You know we moved to AZ a little over a year. Adjusting to a different climate, culture, and food ethnicity I had to really adapt and reset my mindset of how to eat out and learn to try Mexican dishes, since it's all over the place here. Being born and raise in Hawaii we don't have much Mexican places and if we do, it's not the best or it seemed like it wasn't anything fascinating, maybe the margaritas was more tastier because we had our lihing mui margaritas which is da bomb over tequila margaritas!  Coming to this homely restaurant is changing my concept of thinking it's not so bad, in fact it has much more flavors on each bite.  Stepping into the restaurant, although we do not speak the language, I love how they greet us and they know we sorta understand what they are saying! The hostess to our waitress, which we had her twice, have the pleasant hospitality. It does take us awhile to figure out what we wanna eat because the only dishes we are familiar with is "Enchiladas, burritos, guacamole dip, and a few of their tacos" lol... our waitress, she is patient with us as decide!  I love how their are so many Mexicans flock as families to come in and sit around the table Celebrating birthdays and etc. I love how they all greet each other with a hug/kiss before they sit down and here laughter in the air! I miss this sooo much because it reminds me of how our culture back home does the same. The restaurant has good vibes, good energy, laughter and the food is outstanding!  I've been too a few Mexican places and I have a hard to acquiring the taste because I'm unsure or haven't really found anything that I can be drawn too to enjoy!  But, for this place - I am enjoying very much of their atmosphere, I love how our waitress, she remembers us from our first visit & my husband loves the food and so do I. For me to say this is a shocker because I'm not accustom to it!  But, tonight having dinner and just being in the midst of families made it even more special to enjoy the surroundings, their culture, and their amazing dishes... on the other hand, I still have a hard time drinking water from the cup, I have to ask for lots of lemon to kill the pipe water taste!  Friendly, family restaurant, good vibes & now I have kanak attack ...

vkIc-xF-Pgl7ufiN2Kwo-A.text: I've been wanting to try this place out ever since Adam from man vs. Food showcased it. The building is huge and very open and updated.  We were sat pretty quickly although the hostess was m.i.a. for 5 minutes or so.   The menu is HUGE and a little daunting if you don't know what some of the items are. I started out with the chaquito ceviche which was really good and the perfect size. We ordered the pancho via torta and both the Carne asada and pork belly tacos. The full size torta is insanely large, honestly big enough for two people. The Carne asada tacos were very very good, not dry like most places.  The pork belly was decent but lacked in flavor.  Overall the food was a hit, and once the waitress took the order, the food came out quickly.  The kitchen was very efficient.  The downfall of this place is the service. Slow is an understatement and I think it's because they are very understaffed.  Everyone was friendly but water refills rarely occurred and when it was time for the check, the waitress disappeared for 15 minutes!    Bottom line, if you're not in a hurry and willing to sacrifice service for good food, you've got the spot.

KyWvemyQncKx-BrXuz_phA.text: One of my favorite Mexican places. I've been passing by this place for about 8 months, on the way home, before checking it out.  Yelp helped get us in the door, but the very friendly service and awesome authentic and tasty food is what has us coming back.  We'll definitely be back again, and my wife is actually not a big Mexican food fan, but she likes this one.

-ctZzvRSZLls042NtagX1A.text: I came here after craving Mexican food, and checking out these reviews! So glad I did. I brought my family, and my dad is from Mexico City. This restaurant advertises it's Mexico City style food, so we were particularly excited. We came in and were promptly greeted, and noticed it was pretty full. Like the name suggests, they have a wide selection of tortas! My brother ordered the Del Rey, which they mentioned is the most popular. He loved it, my dad loved it, and everyone was happy. The menu is pretty large and you'll have a lot to choose from, and includes some tried and True favorites- like the quesadilla. Our food came out maybe ten minutes after we ordered it. So fast!! My dad commented on how authentic the food was, and everyone enjoyed what they ordered. I'll definitely be back. If you want good Mexican, skip the chains and come here!

kQi8NrXHsygZe02v0rzY3w.text: Chilaquiles had a good sauce, salsa was great. Service warm. Carne asada tacos were delicious. I had mango agua fresca and it delivered

CiZIHWdJLfr4-24BHCgOxg.text: Stopped by for a quick lunch by myself.  I was pleasantly greeted at the entrance and immediately seated at a nice window booth.  The restaurant is fairly spacious, clean and there seemed to be ample wait staff.  I was given complimentary chips and salsa and my order taken promptly.  I ordered the Cubana Torta with ham, pork sirloin, avocado, onions and peppers.  They offer quite a large number of tortas in a couple of sizes.  Plus Burros, Tacos, Quesadillas and some Seafood dishes.  The pork sirloin was well seasoned and sliced thin so it was very tender and complimented the ham.  Overall, the sandwich was tasty and filling.  The torta came with ruffles potato chips right out of the bag which seemed kind of odd.  Some type of "Mexico City" side dish would seem to be more appropriate.  Overall, very satisfied with the service and food.  I'll be back soon to try another Mexican sandwich.

mXVezK-B_eLajr9LHx07bw.text: This is a real Mexican restaurant specializing  in cuisine from the Mexico City region.  The food is authentic and delicious. The staff is great. You know it is real because it is always full of people who really know their food. Not wanna-be's. The chips and salsa are home made and the dishes presented in simple elegance. Here you can step into Mexico without ever leaving home. Los Reyes De La Torta is our 1st choice for Mexican in PHX metro.

0DGdYncYRcdda_AHASST1A.text: Real good! Bunch of beers on tap. Brisket tacos, carnitas both awesome. I thought we only had this kind of Mexican feed in Arizona. Place is clean and nice, and nice lady's working there as well.

sou_zKQYUwcC-YgrbK8WTw.text: We turned into the parking lot a little sooner than we should have and as such we drove by a Taco Bell.  As we did so I commented that if all else fails we could go to Taco Bell.  As we drove through the lot we finally saw the place, parked and entered.  We were immediately seated and soon the chips and salsa arrived.  In short YUCK!!  Chips were stale and the salsa wasn't appreciably better.  Ordered a diet coke and tea.  In short YUCK!!  Tea went back in favor of another diet coke.  Next we ordered...2 tortas...Ranchera de pollo o res (with steak) and a Carne Asada.  As I figured out later I got the wrong sandwich (mine should have had chips but didn't) but at the end both sandwiches were the same albeit what should have been mine had cucumbers, radishes, etc vice chips.  So a couple of observations...every other Carne Asada torta I've ever had came with chopped meat vice strips (quite wide strips).  Moreover, it this is how they do it then other the sides, and as mentioned already, there was NO FRIGGIN DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TWO SANDWICHES...WTF!!!!!!  As for the sandwiches themselves...YUCK!!!  There are far too many places to get a far superior torta in the Valley.  In short, I should have gone to Taco Bell.

O9u_Jns2WsKS3IZPvsj63w.text: Los Reyes De La Torta 1528 E. Southern Avenue Tempe, 85282  I arrived at the restaurant at 11:30, and was seated immediately. The girl seating me noted that the sun was coming in through the windows at the front of the place, and she opted to seat me at a table that would not be in the direct sun light. This was to be the beginning of a nice lunch!  Within a few minutes of my sitting down, I was greeted by my waiter, provided with what I think were homemade chips and two different salsas, as well as 3 different menus. The first menu was the lunch special menu, the second menu was an assortment of drinks on one side and desserts on the other side, and the third menu was their regular menu.  The waiter was prepared for me to take my time ordering, but I opted to order immediately, asking for an item that was not on the menu. I ordered a Lengua Burrito enchilada style with green chili on it. My waiter didn't bat an eye, but did compliment me on my Spanish! LOL.   I started in on the chips, and found them to be delicious, as were both of the salsas. While both exhibited some heat, one was definitely a bit hotter than the other, though both had excellent flavor and body. None of that thin, watery stuff here.  In short order, my burrito arrived. Large, soft, and swimming in a pool of green chili with a little crema squirted over it. It was so good I emptied my entire plate. I also ordered a Tostada de Ceviche in the appetizer size just to try it. As with the burrito, it too was excellent and a nice size just to try it.  Of interest is that the menu contains proteins that are not usually found in most Mexican/American restaurants, including Lengua (tongue), Buche (pork belly), Cabeza (beef head), and Pierna (pork sirloin). I found that the way the menu was designed, every dish was listed both with a full English description as well as a Spanish description.   The only think I did not care for was the televisions all tuned to a different Spanish language station. They took away from the atmosphere, which would have been a lot nicer had there been some good mariachi music in the background instead.  The place was spotlessly clean, and service was excellent. I hope they continue to keep up this level of food and service, because this is one of the very best Mexican style restaurants I have eaten in in this state.  4 stars for excellent food, good cleanliness, and good service

Mqac439F7iZMNqngClSvkw.text: Don't get the hype. A Man vs. Food challenge obviously gave this place loads of attention, which is why we tried it.   Good stuff overall, but didn't meet the hype for me.

OxmtQ6P-48pgzLDH1FAusg.text: Been here a few times. Very convenient location to my home. Love their torta's, however the fact that they come with ruffle chips is a little strange. On some of the larger tortas you could probably get away with splitting the meal, or bringing it home with you. Salsa is spicier than many other Americanized mexican food restaurants, which is an added plus.  At the end of the meal they give you a dum dum lollipop. Only gripe would be the fact that their margaritas are non alcoholic. They should really splurge on getting that liquor license.

VH8A2k1AaxR7kz6g_BG7Lw.text: This place advertises as if is sells alcohol, it does not. I would recommend NOT buying the 5$ margarita that has no alcohol. I made the mistake of asking after the margarita tasted funny to me.

-RroCZxvMvAE8DTeVo4sdA.text: I'm willing to chalk my bad experience up to "working out the kinks", but still don't think I'll be back.  The good news: The place was packed on Friday night at dinner time. I got my food to go and the staff were very polite and accommodating. The food was hot and the salsa that came with it was great.  The bad news: I ordered a chicken torta for my husband and got beef instead. I ordered a vegetarian burrito for myself and there was A) a big piece of meat in it and B) a long hair in the center. That ended dinner pretty quickly for me.  Disappointing...I was hoping this would be a great new go-to local place.

HaM7TZ5A_nHBXQiqVzv05Q.text: Love, love, love!  The new lunch menu is great; cheap too!  I always get the egg and chorizo burrito and it comes with rice and beans, Yum!    My friend loves the chocoflan dessert they have and I like the tres lechwe cake

oj6M435TChzSSFyAbOZzzw.text: This place was absolutely amazing. This was the best service I have ever gotten! I almost felt like I was at a 5 star restaurant. This place was really clean and the food was the best I ever had. I will be coming here a lot more often from now on!

arUTevTr5G6XwRhHcfT-Eg.text: Make no mistake, the Del Rey torta was tasty in its own right.  But with the hype built from Man vs. Food and other reviews it was bit of a letdown.  The refried beans worked well in the torta but the other components just seemed like a big mess of meaty ingredients piled high.  Good if your looking to munch, not so much if your expecting a top-tier torta.  Mexican food in Cali has still been surprisingly better even though one could assume AZ is closer and home to the real deal. (Like the sign Los Reyes says, Real Authentic Mexico City Food)  They also serve huge drinks without alcohol....wat Hopefully they acquire their beverage license soon.

_VyZk1z09V5Q4BWAuj0maQ.text: No alcohol served!!! Selection of tortas is unmatched. Good service. If you're brave enough to try the Del Rey better not eat breakfast. I hope I don't get the gout.

FmIXJowXuJ2j6ZV3nX7f3w.text: Went to this place with my handsome Mexican fiance, and he was totally impressed with the authenticity of the food and drink! I was equally impressed with the selection and deliciousness! Tons of fresh produce to accompany the filling, meaty dishes! Great balance! Great service! Give it a try!

QjOhM0VWoRZJmIve_YTAoQ.text: When everyone in this place is Hispanic, and we are the only Caucasians in the place we figured this has to be authentic! The food was great! The service was great! And they serve COKE, not pepsi so that is always a huge thumbs up. I had the USA Torta, which is like a sandwich, breaded chicken, ham, pineapple and cheese with a chipotle sauce, lots of food and very good...I took 1/2 home!   I had passed this place 100 times recently and the parking lot seemed always busy. We love Mexican food so I was hesitant since I remember being a kid and going to this place when it was JB's for breakfast with my grandmother. Place was great, and will for sure back to try something else.

oQbF4SzTj1FU2HiAY-EDFw.text: Really good and authentic Mexican food. from the ambiance, to the decoration and the food. really good place to eat Mexican food.

9n9Fvkp32iJrRKE-HIQ4SQ.text: Came here for the first time and tried their steak torta.  Very simple but had a solid flavor.   Will be back to try some of their other menu items.

Q-m5BmhzCu5tsSbLIsek-g.text: Everyone around here has a different 'favorite' Mexican restaurant and this is mine. Good vegetarian selection. The portions are big, like a lot of Mexican places, so you'll probably have leftovers for lunch the next day.

IQfp3CnS7MfMS-Ukhq3LqA.text: This place never disappoints!!!! They have the best cheese quesadilla on earth! We don't really understand  how they can take a tortillla and cheese and make it so much better than anyone else! My husband always gets La Reyna and I always get the Peluche. Sometimes service is slow, but tonight Tony was really a great server. The owner is usually there and working just as hard as everyone else. Great local spot that you can't miss!

V6wfmWlQB3guIO4cl7-H-w.text: I tend to go to all the locations they have here in phoenix. But this is my favorite one, since I live near it. The first thing that will grab your attention, is the employees. They have what are perhaps the nicest, most Courteous employees that can be found! They blow you away with the hospitality here.  The food here is also ridiculously flavorful, and delicious. I usually always get the Tortas, but when I bring friends along, or the wife they all get different things. I have tried just about everything here. The aguas, and fantastic. I've only ever had one issue, but it was not at this location but at the cave creek one. It seems that sometime the Pina Coladas are made differently. But other than that always great food. Try the licuados! Last but not least, the employees. The waitresses, and especially the hostesses are the definition of hospitality. They treat you like you are part of their family!

-HPLQmeH2YkS4c7hH_PQpA.text: I was PUMPED to try this place because the food looks so good in the pictures! My experience ended up being just okay, but I'm willing to go back to try other dishes if I'm in the area.  Upon first walking in, there definitely was that faint sulphur-like, sewery smell that was mentioned in a few older reviews. Definitely not a super appetizing way to start off! I braved the slight stench and decided to order anyway, hoping the food would make up for it.   I got the shrimp ceviche and iconic del Rey torta. The ceviche looked good but lacked flavor, and the torta gave me strong hotdog flavor vibes that I couldn't shake off.   I have high hopes the beautiful looking quesadillas can be their saving grace for me so I will be back to try those.   For now, Los Reyes is a hard pass for my torta needs!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp Ceviche - lacked flavor
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Del Rey torta - ham/hot dog flavor was a bit too strong for my liking

m8skhV504EYO3IuEKStyiw.text: Their tortas were super huge and definitely can share for 2 people.  Great taste also. Price is pretty average for a Mexican restaurant. Will be back to try other items in the menu.

CU74nu-wo4u70-PjfSagDg.text: This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant! I prefer seafood and typically l don't find it on our regular Mexican hangouts.  I end up have Chile relleno. Not today! There were many options for pescatorians and vegetarians, woot woot!  For my first time here l picked the ceviche tostada and a side of beans. Ron got a chicken quesadilla. We were both amazed how good everything tasted! Our waitress and hostess were so helpful, friendly and attentive.  Prices are  $ food tastes $$$. We will be back soon to explore their menu further!

f4fMjsKn49hI8JZX7p69sw.text: I'm from Los Angeles. It's pretty known that AZ doesn't have many authentic Mexican food restaurants. This is one of them AHAHA! However, the food is actually pretty good! I believe the meat could've had a bit more moisture. I love juicy tasty chicken & they didn't offer that. Not saying it was bad but could've tasted WAAAAAAY better. I really love the salsa they have for the chips it's hot :). The staff is amazing & accommodating. My favorite overall is the mango & orange smoothie or whatever it's called. They do not serve alcohol btw, supposedly you bring your own alcohol & mix it into whatever you purchase which I personally felt was odd but whatever.

W6Aha-SMrsBflfr4Yk7x8Q.text: The Tortas here are phenomenal. The meat, bun and all of the ingredients are all very fresh and very high quality. Staff was very friendly and attentive. The place looked well cared for and clean. I had the Nortena steak Torta and it was fantastic. This might be my new Torta spot!!

nFPLyRQQep2J3TcFsNDu7A.text: Food was really good. We had Torta Del Rey and the Nopales. Highly recommend you have an angus Fresca.  Service was excellent. If your hungry stop by!

CQJcWslY-xbCHjLNBnrV8A.text: Love this place. The Torta del Rey is the best torta in the Phoenix area. It's massive and full of different flavorful meats. It's well worth the price.  The atmosphere. As you would expect is very lively and festive. Plenty of tv's to watch sports.

Jstc7cY53S9_bZhC3l-hpg.text: Tried for the first time tonight I tried the carnita and Cabeza tacos they were awesome. Our waitress was lovely! I didn't get a chance to ask her name. Huge menu and good vibes. Definitely a place to try!

3s4dPc44pfCyaC0gmvD9EQ.text: Love this place.  Wonderful Tortas, tacos, great breakfast foods as well.  Very friendly service.  Love the hot sauce.  If you love quality Mexican food there will be something on the menu for you

_AHMAWvFqiyKHMUpgQe6VA.text: Authentic Mexican cuisine that makes you feel like you're in Mexico City. The food is delicious and the service is quick and attentive. The atmosphere of the restaurant is welcoming and makes you feel like apart of the family. Expect to spend some coin there, but it is well worth it.

Y2Kg7sJfjx062t3RTiffOQ.text: Terrible customer service skills. The food is "okay." Not 100% authentic for the price. The waitresses need to learn how to treat their customers with respect. They also need to learn how to take orders and give people the food they ordered & not charge people for things they didn't even give them in the first place. I used to like this place but this time around...... I am very dissatisfied!

uY90SByNqcrqsbrNPPUHVg.text: This place is terrible. NO ALCOHOL on Cinco De Mayo. I think this is awful I want a Huge Margarita not a Virgin!!!!!?  Our server sucks first of all we only 6 out of 11 people have water. The bowl of salsa is like a kid size bowl, chips are disgusting not made fresh. I think they are pulled out of a bag. Dont waste your time eating here terrible!!!!!

OiJlcsYSvExNrz5FTtKn9Q.text: I can't believe I haven't eaten here before.  We had a coupon so we figured why not.  So glad we stopped by to try this place.  Our server was very friendly and gave us some great suggestions.  We took his suggestion and was so glad.  Food was fantastic.  This evening we were one of the few gringos in the place and we will certainly be back.  Service and food was great.  We ordered their quesadilla 50/50 with each half different types of meat.  I am glad they did this for us.  It was a great suggestion and so filling.  Come hungry.

OqzYz6aeJ8PcaleeEoqoWA.text: Wow! Talk about amazing service !! The place is so cute inside and food is amazing! Huge portions and super cheap! Our waiter was super friendly and we had a good time eating here! The menu is has lots to offer, so no problem finding something to eat. Will be returning very soon!

yRyM8g96YZjEhKlAzwoyjA.text: So bomb!! Love the ceviche tostadas. Plus the food really looks like the pictures!! The staff is always genuinely nice

zU7U7mSRpME45CI_dVhy2w.text: My wife and I just had lunch at this authentic Mexican restaurant.  We ordered the following dishes: 1. Tacos de Camaron 2. Alambre de Res o Pollo 3. Desert - Flan Napolitano  The crust of the tortillas was soft, chewy and beautifully thinly wrapped around the dish #1.  Probably the best tasting crust that I've ever had.  The dish #2 was super-size serving, so we had to take the remaining food home.    The waitress and the rest of the staff was very nice and cordial, as well as helpful with the menu.  We like it so much that we are taking our guest to this spot for dinner tomorrow night.  Made reservations and they allow us to choose the larger-style corner for 4 adults and 1 child.    There is so much on the menu that we want to try, so we plan to come back soon.  This is a happy customer!

ynubxytBAjxRpbY5kxukhg.text: Get the Alambra burrito or casedilla. You will not regret it. I've been going here since it opened and everytime I go, the food is fabulous. The wait staff are super nice, and give off an "I actually care about this place" vibe. In a big city, Reyas has that mom and pop feel. I also recommend the agua frescas, particularly the melon one.

5vT0Y90ljCunSYNl18No2g.text: Is our first time here with my hubby, and we are definitely coming back. The menu is huge, they have a lot of options for everybody. The food is amazing! We got the Principe torta (pork sandwich) and a chicken corn tortilla, both were really good. Also got Mango agua fresca (mango juice), delicious!!!  Tony was our server and he was attentive, nice and really has knowledge of the menu, his recomentadions were spot on. Prices are fair. Don't miss it!

qq5_HnrvjsQ3QqCahwOyTQ.text: bomb bomb bomb .... the food was amazing !!! service was great ! everything we ordered had that thick maiz tortilla! just like my grandmother used to make them .... didn't find this place intentionally didn't even know about it. we where on our way home and where hungry ... and seen this place so decided to stop... i am glad we did !! food was so good i ate mines really quick and wanted to finish everyone elses on the table however they wanted to take it to go! just my luck  im in the car now literally feel like im about to go into a food coma ... nighty night !!!

EYFk8EtNhmUwVGVhpa0ndw.text: This place is Bomb.com/org lol highly recommend this place if you want some chip and salsa that actually has some flavor and spice :) good ambiance and great service, let's not forget the authentic Mexican flavor!

tKIsnvVyLJ307sV_2S82Tw.text: Los Reyes de la Torta serves fairly authentic Mexican food.  Services is efficient and friendly.  The restaurant was pleasantly not crowded when we came here for a Sunday lunch.  Chips and salsa immediately arrived, and the food was surprisingly quick to arrive after we ordered.  The Del Rey is one of their biggest tortas - ham, cheese, pork, hot dog omelet, and more!  Of course, I had to give this a try since it sounds like a meat lovers dream.  I have to say - it is a little TOO flavorful.  The combination of meats, egg, cheese, and avocado kind of blend together.  While it's not at all bad per se, the tastiness of each ingredient is overwhelmed.  Eh...worth a try anyway.  Burritos were good.  Nice grilled texture, and perfect ratio of ingredients - you have a wide variety of filling choices.  There's also a nice selection of plated entrees.  Price is reasonable - $4 to $10 per dish.  The decor is also nice.  I was expecting a dive-type hole in the wall, but it's actually fairly clean (though I didn't use the restroom and can't judge there).

ee-HG3uWO93u92O_ES7Ycg.text: Service was good and food was awesome. I got the steak Tacos with rice and beans.  The tacos were great and it was a  lot of food. I would recommend it if your in the area.

UZMcc44w0eBkSWQgEMYemw.text: I had dinner here last night after it being on my bookmarks for awhile and I was very pleased with my meal. We were greeted immediately and seated in a booth. Our server was very friendly and attentive throughout the meal. We snacked on the chips and salsa they brought out and I am in love with their red salsa. It is very spicy but I could not stop eating it. Their other salsa was good as well. I decided on the Mexicana Torta (grilled steak, guac, onions, jalapenos) with horchata and I really liked it. I ended up adding some of the red salsa, but on its own it was good and flavorful. I am already thinking about when I will go back again to try something else.

14DveCrGTEsszjCrrhNP7g.text: First time here and all i can say is that i liked it a lot...  We were driven here after watching the show Man vs Food.  The Torta del Rey is awesome and huge...  The Mango "agua fresca" wasnt that good due that the mango wasnt in season so it was a bit sour...  Service from the waitress was excellent..  In general, its the most mexican like food i've tasted here in AZ...

7mgzMoJFM4v-O3pimgDAIg.text: I always order the Del Rey torta and it is loaded with delicious meat. Amazing. This place has great tortas as well as quesadillas, burritos, and etc. If you want authentic Mexican food try this place. Not your typical cheesy and bean filled tex mex. Los Reyes has good quality and flavor along with great service.

J-piLt9Ry5HpMq3f-ooVww.text: Sometimes you are just craving Mexican food and want to try someplace new. Well I wouldn't recommend this place. They do not serve alcohol, which is weird because who doesn't want a margarita with their tacos? The menu is very confusing and even shows drinks, but they are all non-alcoholic. The service was very slow and not very good. The whole experience was mediocre, which is disappointing because I love Mexican food. A LOT!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken quesadilla

KdsydptgrcKB-HbCawMZEg.text: I grew up in central Mexico and Los Reyes de la torta has exactly the same amazing food you would find there. The menu has great diversity for food and drinks! Definitely one pf the very few places in the valley where you can eat real Mexican food!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Huevos divorciados!!

kL-SlCLEVVvSOvTjgLgbdg.text: Your juices and bombas are divine and the service is superb. The torta was a bit spicy for my taste, but I bet there are people out there who absolutely love the heat. I'll go for something a bit milder next time. I had no idea this little gem was hidden down here in Tempe. Must repeat visit.

_HdWI11B3XUqelQQd5DxPg.text: Not quite as good as the main location, but still kicks ass!  My only critique is that they don't serve a complimentary chunky salsa along with their hot salsa.    Get the agua fresca, try an appetizer (we like the queso dip w mushrooms) and finish with one of the many Torta options they have.    Personally, I love anything with steak at Los Reyes.  If they cook it fresh, it's incredible and very authentic!  My wife had the steak fajita plate thing and I had the steak Torta.  Her steak was obviously fresher and hotter.. Absolutely delicious!!!  Mine was warm, but not quite as freshly cooked.  Still tasty as hell, but I wish they were more consistent.  They have some cool fresh fruit options here.  Both in the agua fresca and in their dessert options.  Not too pricy either!  NOTE:  The main location was featured on Man vs Food (Food Network),  Adam had the loaded Torta (forgot the name but you'll see it!)

EBVUYQiW5QuOm6MJuaJtwg.text: When i lived in Arizona, i always traveled to their North Phoenix location.  Recently i was in Tempe and realized they opened one there.  The food was just as good and i was so happy to have my favorite Torta the Nortena Steak Torta! I can't wait to visit again when i'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Torta nortena.

u5PkBoXWNjJgx8ImeY1TRQ.text: Ok I'm not sure how to review this place because I think I made an error in my food order. I tried the Torta Del Ray as this seems to be the popular sandwich.  The positive: it was huge. Good choice if you are hungry.... And a carnivore.  The negative: huge mishmash of meats with flavors that weren't complimentary of one another. I did not understand the addition of hotdogs onto this sandwich- seems more like they are going for being eclectic rather than flavorful.  Salsa was rather bland. Our server was very attentive and friendly. Would go back for the smoothies- lots of fun, yummy non-alcoholic beverages.  Would be nice if they served alcohol too!!

JE4zW-bT6-tsjtOsIvgG4w.text: Having been to the Phoenix location months ago, I brought my Mexican-food-craving girlfriend here the other night for a good, filling meal. We arrived and were seated despite the late hour (past 8pm on a Sunday), among two or three other occupied tables.    Our waiter, Oscar, was quick with the humor and very amiable. We had the (huge) Botana de Camaron (ceviche, cocktail shrimp, cucumber/tomato/avocado) plate - $12 - to start and enjoyed how refreshing and tasty that was before my Torta Del Rey (5 different meats, an egg, avocado, cheese, etc) - $10 - and my girlfriend's chorizo (made in-house) tacos - $6.25 - were served to the table*.    *Warning: bring a healthy appetite as all of these dishes are made to satisfy.    Finished off with a slice of Tres Leches cake on the house ($5 - Mail Coupon, Thanks Oscar!) and it was sweet dreams from then on...    TL;DR: Great spot for Mexican food in the Tempe area, excellent staff at this location... Come hungry!

0nUhWlvauD-omMjoZWNCQQ.text: agua de sandia! in loooove! Food is also so good and service was quick (we visited around 4 on a Friday) but all around really good and would definitely keep coming back, yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Agua de sandia

5UElgTEbB6U-tYbAqvYwMg.text: Easily the best sandwiches I have ever had. The USA sandwich was great, it contained a mixture of flavors that went great together.

D1MnYAz3b3AC67zj0wnrpg.text: Los Reyes is too awesome. first we went i had the Plato de Alambre de Camaron which is the grilled shrimp plate,and the Coctel de Cameron 'grande"..  which is a large shrimp cocktail. soooo good i had to go back 2 days later and had the shrimp cocktail again and a grilled steack and onion burro. my girlfriend had a chicken torta.  it was hella good!!!! next time i go gonna try the tacos......

hsTV0YmiEt2ox7H4gVkZ6Q.text: I tried my first torta years ago at a Baja Fresh and fell in love with Mexican sandwiches.  Surprisingly enough, Baja Fresh had extremely good tortas and most of the other places I went to couldn't compare.  Man Versus Food introduced me first to the original location in Phoenix and I couldn't get enough of the place.  Then my prayers were answered last year when a location opened up near home in Tempe.  Hallelujah and pass the chips and salsa.  The menu is slightly overwhelming, but the food, from the salads to the beans to the wide selection of tortas is of very good quality.  Yes, I love this particular LRDLT because it's close to home, but more importantly it's an actual restaurant that provides chips and spicy salsa (unlike the Phoenix location) when you first sit down.  Service is friendly and it's fast.  I think I may have gotten my Del Rey Torta before I ordered it.  That's fast service!  Pork, hot dogs, egg, ham and cheese and I don't know what else all in a sandwich?  Yup, that's the magnificently tasty Del Rey.    I highly recommend this place.  If you're a fan of quality Mexican food at extremely reasonable prices and you're not sure if you want some seafood, a salad or a torta, LRDLT can satisfy a variety of cravings.  **Tip 1**  This place serves booze!!!  I love the aguas frescas at the Phoenix location, but without booze, I was left missing that extra something.  I need miss out no longer  **Tip 2**  Do you like grilled veggies like it do?  Order the side of grilled sliced onions and jalapenos and the cucumber slices and radishes.  Oh the humanity!!!  **Tip 3**  Check your mailbox!!!!  I have received several mailers with 20% discounts on your entire LRDLT check!

iGWgBsi9JRRqXuOF_Ynz2g.text: I've ordered food to go from here several times and have never been disappointed in the least! The food is fantastic, especially the shrimp burrito, my personal fave. I've had the veggie burro too and that was pretty good. The staff is ok. Some of them are really nice but there are a few that are kinda shitty. Ignore them, just eat :)   I love the grilled onion, lime, radishes, etc. that they add as a garnish. I can't wait to go again.

lgW8ejm5IYegOBuhedQFmw.text: This is one of our favorite Mexican restaurants in the East Valley. Authentic D.F. style food. It is a large restaurant space but can still be packed, especially on the weekends.  The chips are fresh and there is a salsa picante that you can ask for that is very flavorful with a nice kick. We typically get a huarache, the pambazo, or chilaquiles but have never been disappointed there. The portion sizes are large so be forewarned.  There is great value for the cost. They have told us in the past that it is BYOB, but we typically stick to the horchata or aguas frescas.

DdLuPY7zXSw3wrop0Kzo1Q.text: This was a great authentic Mexican restaurant. We ordered aguas frescas and they were in slushy form, refreshing and not too sweet.   The green chili enchiladas were great, not too spicy and a great portion size. La reina torta is delicious, I ordered the mini and it was bigger than expected.   We also ordered the carne asada quesadilla on a flour tortilla - it was perfect. Great cheese-to-meat ratio as well as green chili. The tortilla was homemade which makes all the different.   Staff is friendly and service was great.

Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States

mC4YIGVd-0GpkXsDdv1__g.text: These guys are Classy as they come. The food here is top notch Mexican city fare and then some. The reason I am writing this review is to let them know how much I appreciate their business here in Tempe. Not too many times does a review have much to say about the people behind the food. Tonight I approached the restaurant and noticed a big sign taped to the front door that grabbed my attention. "to our valued customers. We will be closed on the 4th of July to celebrate Independence Day".   Estoy siempre agradecido.  Happy Fourth of July to you! Soup C.

hMeJiid2eUnzq5btr-jkWg.text: Great Tortas!  I wasn't sure what to expect but the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming.  Please be aware that this is an authentic Mexican restaurant.  While they do speak English, Spanish is the primary language, my server kept speaking to me in Spanish first, then English.  Since the menu is authentic Mexican there can be some choices that one may not be familiar with.  Always ask before you order.  I enjoyed everything! I never knew tortas could taste so good! The place was quite busy for dinner but I never felt neglected and the service was really good.  Definitely coming back!

-x-lByrMv84mmREmJW4L6Q.text: Probably a 3.5 star restaurant.  Ordered - Burro Vegetarian : medium sized burrito served with a side of salad and sauteed onions. Did not look filling so I ordered a side of rice and beans( they don't serve black beans).  Starting with burrito, bell peppers were under cooked and couldn't eat. Rest of the stuffing was good. Just saw 6 vegetarian options on the menu though. Waitress was too frequent to check on my table like every other minute. I know they care about customers, but check on the status every minute?  Okay, real deal? I paid $14 and yet I wasnt full. Quantities are less for the price you pay.  Decent ambience, sorta mexicano interiors, 0 wait times and not so great food.

GJp63WSZbIlLce6fE7OicA.text: I'm not that type of person who's writing reviews, but that place is something else  the customer service was on the highest level! Me and my bf came there to get dinner to go, the waitress came to greet us right the way. I wanted something special to put together and they had no problems with my order. Fast and organized :) thank you , definitely will be coming back!

3-10PVSiYmfVV7JkrRwgDA.text: Just moved here in Tempe from Alaska and I'm a person who is not culturally exposed to Mexican food since there's not much from my home state. I walked into this restaurant per the recommendation of my apartment complex that happens to be in the same block. I have tried the Torta, and it's loaded with meat. If you are a meat lover and the type of person who needs loads of protein this is your order of choice. The vibe is very homie and you will notice that the workers treat each other as family member. I will be coming back to try another dish anytime soon!

aMgQ8pOKffBhFvQdXOgD5A.text: The best food in Tempe my last time couple years ago I tried it the same test right now you guys did a great job you guys the best very clean nice service I love this place

wEkjtW8JTkJY4zam9vQlhQ.text: "The king is dead. Long live the queen!" I bellowed loudly from a mountain of tables and chairs as I took down the last bite of the Torta King Carlo V.!   Sweet little grandmas comforted sobbing cherubs, ladies dabbed at their eyes with silk handkerchiefs, and men bowed their heads at the greatness that is Joyce W. --- La reina de la tortas!  Okay, you caught me on my delusion of grandeur. None of this happened. I didn't even get the Torta King Carlo V.! Fake news! Even if this were to happen, my friends would tell me to stop talking and eat my food. #SitDown #StayHumble  It was a spicy hot 111F at 1:30PM on this unforgiving summer day. The things we do to dine with good Yelpers, right? We also had a surprise guest! It's SO GOOD to finally meet you, Alana M.! For my meal, I had a gigantic mangonada and the mini La Reina Torta. If I wasn't going to go after King Carlos V., I'll challenge the queen instead... and oh my goodness. That queen was frickin delicious!   The La Reina Torta had a soft squishy bread that didn't buckle from all the goodies inside. It had ham, cheese, a breaded chicken breast, a breaded beef patty, sausage wrapped with egg, tomato, onions, avocado, and chipotle sauce. The mini was already an intimidating portion and I can't imagine how the regular size would be like. I was extremely satisfied with my lunch and I would definitely come back for more tortas if I were in the area.  In this battle of Joyce v. Food, Joyce won!  Notes:  - Los Reyes De La Tortas was featured on Travel Channel's Man v. Food! - This place is BYOB!

xJEugYwRS1S97WBuoK4FDQ.text: Recently ate here for the first time and it was nothing short of amazing ! My husband and I are pretty picky with Mexican food as we often travel to Mexico and its hard to find something decent but this place was amazing and had great customer service!

N5bLAUNaK_aynHCAB8GplA.text: Note to self: when going to new Mexican Food Restaurant during the World Cup and Mexico is playing...take time to read the menu. First time here. Menu is massive.   Ordered the Pambazo Torta. Thought it had roast beef. Presented with this huge sandwich. After eating half of the tasty meal...did not recall seeing the roast beef. Started to disect the second half and saw what I thought was refried beans. Strange... why would one put refried beans on a torta. You do see refried beans in a burro. Hey maybe the roast beef is mixed in with refried beans.  Server asked how I liked the torta. Said it was great what was in it. She said chorizo and potatoe. There are  no refried beans or roast beef in it. That made things pretty clear.  Probably try something else on next trip. Will be sure to do my research ahead of time. Authentic and tasty. Actually broke a sweat which means good heat.
