YQLaDcFuPio2Rpb-CqDT2A.text: This is my absolute favorite spot for Mexican food! I always order for delivery so I've never actually been to the place but oh my god the food!! I love the enchiladas and the tacos! I have never had either anywhere else that were this good. I literally have dreams about them! They also give you a jalapeno with your tacos that is so hot it'll knock your socks off! I love it. If you haven't been, you must!!

QjOHOJDa8RidHG4jN5lBaQ.text: My husband and I stopped in for lunch on our way home from Mesa to North Phoenix after I got off of work. We decided to travel on the city streets instead of traveling on the 60 to the 101 like we normally do Monday through Friday. This restaurant is a sweet, hidden oasis on Southern Ave in Tempe. Their style of cooking is original, old Mexican style. It was delicious! Every bite a mouth watering delight of just the right spicy goodness with a mild touch of heat. I ordered the shrimp tacos with salad and my husband ordered the green chili chicken enchiladas. His meal came with white rice with vegetables tucked inside. Every bite was absolutely amazing. In addition, I ordered a raspberry iced tea--that was sweetened naturally. It was cold and refreshing-just the way I like it.  If you're in the area, I would suggest looking this restaurant up. You will be glad you did.

N2eVXo2eW-v-UBY2xkpBXw.text: My family and I stopped in for lunch and from the moment we entered to sitting every staff member greeted us as we passed by. Being our fist time the waiter made some suggestions which turned out to be amazing. My wife and I shared a plate and they took the liberty of splitting the meal onto separate plates for us. The food fantastic, and large. Even half the meal I was full by the end. The waiter, Tony, learned our names in the beginning and continued to use our names the whole time. Tony was attentive to us and the other tables he served as well. When leaving he shook our hand... nobody does that but I appreciated the heck out of it. Also, the bathrooms were as clean as a Marriott hotel's bathroom. The food was great, the service was even better, and the cleanliness was perfect. Definitely recommend if you're looking for Mexican food, I'll be back there when I'm in town again.

aN2TpjoshOKMKnGxRIQ17A.text: This is a busy place!  Clean!  Simple!  Friendly service. They take away your plates fast.   They do provide the complimentary chips and salsa.  A nice salsa. Not too much flavor but fresh. I did ask for a spicy one. And it was not spicy and .... well .... had an interesting taste. Large large menu. Many many choices. Some expensive. Some cheap!  A good variety. We had a chorizo and nopales as well Grilled shrimp Tacos de Alambre de Camaron. Grilled shrimp mixed with bell  pepper, onions, bacon and melted cheese on top, salad, grilled  onions and jalapenos on the side mixed with bell  pepper, onions...  the chorizo was excellent. The Alhambre...no bacon!  What?  Where's the bacon. So so disappointed.  The salad was about a tablespoon size. Ha ha. I was ok with that. The jalapenos were grilled and excellent.   A busy place. Large menu with simple flavors.

Cyjd40jbUHXtR_08cusMFw.text: A co-worker suggested getting food from here and I'm usually pretty skeptical about places I've never tried but I decided to trust the yelp ratings and give it a shot.  I have to start by saying their delivery service, AZ Delivery 2U, was horrible.  My order confirmation said my food would be here "ASAP (12:17PM)."  The driver came in at 12:35PM.  It was hard to get information out of them.  When I called all I got was "oh, it always takes an hour."  If that's the case they should put an hour as the ETA on their confirmations in my opinion.  But I digress.  This review is about the food.  Our lunch was fantastic!  Thankfully still piping hot when the driver (finally) got here.  I had a chicken burrito and it was freaking delicious.  I always have to customize my orders because I'm such a picky eater and my order was exactly the way I asked for it.  My co-worker got a torta and that thing was insane.  It had ham, cheese, an omelet, even a hot dog on it!  He said it was ridiculously good.  I wish this place wasn't so far from work.  I would absolutely get food from here again but certainly not for delivery.

Z-s6fzN8fofxIGrSTyx3IQ.text: I haven't been to a Mexican restaurant for a while. This place has super friendly customer service. I ordered a fish tacos because I usually don't eat meat.  The menu says super tacos which I expected to be larger than the regular tacos on the menu. When the food came out, in my opinion, these tacos look the same size as the Tacos de asada that my friend ordered. I like the flavor but the texture of the tacos are a bit rubbery in the edge.  I tried the tres leches King Cake. I would not say I don't like it but since I don't like very sweet dessert, I gave up after one bite but people who like sweet food may thing this is good.  The horchata is delicious. Although a first few sips, I felt powders in it but still, that was good PS: I'm saying this from a Tucsonian's perspective because Tucson offers a variety of authentic Mexican food.

Yhp5j1O2fTzYSjgYdd_WQA.text: My mouth waters every time I think of this place.  The food is awesome and the (non)-alcoholic drinks are great.  I don't drink, so its nice to order something a little fancier than soda, lol.  Service has always been great here, every waiter I've had has always been very nice and helpful and in general happy.  Its for sure more casual but still a sit down place.  As far as I can tell the restaurant seems clean.  I think the biggest group we've take is about ten and the accommodated that no problem.  Sorry I don't have any pictures of the food, but consider that a compliment that I can't control myself once the food arrives.

09lZ4zfRrNg__VOdaJF4jw.text: Authentic Mexican food, place had a chain feel to it and service was just ok. Little slow and could use a good cleaning. Food was good, definitely not the best I've had but definitely 3 star good. Salsa & pina  was probably my favorite part of my meal otherwise probably would of been a 2 start for me.

TAj1Ft0KAao8ZPXyECajJw.text: So yummy! Friendly and fast delivery, food was hot and delicious :) definitely will be back.

V514fSmdILyFzelojzxqKA.text: I will never come here or any other reyes de la torta i drove 30 mins to here just to be told i couldn't dine in. i got here at 8:50 and they didnt want to seat me down they were only doing togo, Which is stupid!

B6TgAsmDuuN_keG5-hLSRw.text: Wonderful salsas, terrific portion sizes and awesome dessert! I have been there three times now and have no intention on stopping! One of the most friendly waiters I've ever had at ANY restaurant, the place was absolutely swamped (I went there on a Saturday evening at 6:30) but the food came out quick with zero mistakes, same with the desert. Completely awesome place!

M4Estq5AKvpODSF_LQGS-g.text: Stopped at this place(on southern in Tempe) as a coworker of mine was highly suggesting this was the BEST place to get carne asada tacos. Traveled from Tucson and met family here. The place was clean and the staff was inviting and friendly. Service was good, Horchata was Bueno and homemade tasting. Shrimp was really good. But the Carne asada tacos were not the good I was expecting... They were bland, beans were freshly cold from a can and bland, rice had no flavor and no color and the bistek had no flavor.   I love customer service so I gave the place a 3 star. Maybe I visited on an off day and will give it another try, another time.

5uQrYHSgC54Jvc7tD6qupg.text: So, so good. Great enchiladas (oh god the fresh cheese), amazing burros (get the bistec with red sauce), cactus tacos, giant tortas, and more. Don't let the former Denny 's look from outside throw you off. This place is great. Service is friendly and on top of it plus the chips and salsa are delish.

muFrMvzCKxwPSHdvajRCbg.text: I got the torta Rey. I think it's called. It was good. There was a lot of meat. The taste didn't blow me out of the water, but I liked it.  It tasted authentic. It's not as Americanized.

CGe1OfYyNa9eixF-hC60-A.text: unfortunately for this place, their food is pretty good but their prices are OUTRAGEOUS!!!   I ordered the quesadilla de maiz w Carne asada and a water. she asked if I wanted some crumbled cheese and a drizzle of sour cream on top so i said sure. then I asked for a bit of guacamole on the side (seriously, "a bit" - it only lasted for half my quesadilla).   my bill was OVER $15  i almost ordered a horchata but she said a glass of that was $5!!!  like I said, pretty good food but ludicrous prices. I will not be going back for this reason. I hope you enjoyed the extra few dollars you charged this one visit instead of having a return customer who would have brought an extra person back, possibly a couple times.

yP0lLuzCVdRNjG_21Gf-pw.text: Decided to give this place a shot for lunch one day. As other reviews had stated there was a sewage type smell upon entering. thank god it went away when I was seated, but not a good impression. my experience gets better though. The waitress was very friendly and even though I couldn't prounouce the menu items she was very nice. I ordered a horchata, which was wonderful. Then I got a one of the chicken tostada. The sandwich was great. Nice tosted bun with lots of flavorful chicken and filling. the salad on the side was a joke though. more of a decoration than edible. A few radishes, a grilled onion, jalapeno and cucumber on top of a bite or two of lettuce. I did eat part of the onion and added the cucumber and lettuce to the tostada, but now I know what to expect next time. The free chips and salsa were so so. the salsa was very runny with little flavor. Overall because I enjoyed the food I will be back. maybe I'll try a different location, the sewage smell kind of frightens me on what's behind the scenes.

koBSNfHV3tSWe8PEO4u1Mw.text: Rad food. Only gripe is that the spice level is Midwestern mild. Aside from the tiny bottle of chile pequin hot sauce, there was hardly any spice to anything. That was great for the toddler in tow, because she could eat it all, and even slurped full spoonfuls of their salsa (which was odd).   Norteno de res torta is my favorite packed with steak and avocado. Chorizo is really well flavored too (and not at all spicy). But the quesadilla maiz en estilo del rey is the way to go! Gigantic homemade corn tortilla folded over melty cheese and your choice of filling, topped with cotija and crema and cilantro. So tasty.   I've tried their namesake torta del rey before, and only recommend it if you are getting the sandwich to go because that monster is unwieldy (unless you can unhinge your jaw like a snake) and will fall apart despite your best intentions. But then it turns into a sampler platter of every meat they offer? Anyway, at least at home your glutton ways are masked from sight, and you can get as bad as you wanna be on that behemoth torta.   Aguas are good too. Watermelon for life.

Y1zdr3Tl_ywwvmsKQxGzMg.text: My server was adorable! He was so informative and had so much patience with me. He even told me his favorite in each category and why! I loved it. My chicken nortena torta was pretty good, but the carne asada quesadilla was awesome and even better as leftovers. It was too big too eat all at once. I also like how they served small, inexpensive ceviche tostadas, just to take the edge off while you wait for your entree! Very clean, sweet place!  Also, I have to say, go here before you go next door to spokes. That place is a joke  when it comes to their food.

y-YFXQVZ3ybofKejOo5A8w.text: Really an interesting spot, with a menu that will make you wonder what other Mexican dishes exist that other casual Mex restaurants don't offer. The options are wildly different from what you may be used to. I may have chosen wrong with the house specialty featuring hot dogs. Not for me; maybe you? I suggest trying the spot to find out. We were here a while back, and at the time no liquor, wine or beers available, so consider that.

kmp4Rc_Afa6e-79k5LfTdQ.text: Had the chorizo quesadilla which was fantastic. My buddy had the shrimp tacos which he said were delicious. Customer service was good. Very authentic Mexican food.

jVDPAnkyQjEfZmAauLP1HQ.text: Dropped in for lunch on a Sunday at noon. Large restaurant with several rooms and a friendly efficient staff. The restaurant is clean and brightly decorated and the restroom was more than adequate. The wife ordered Torta nortena de res (yelp.com/biz_photos/los-...) and I had the Torta USA, very tasty and interesting mixed ingredient sandwiches, with different meats, cheese, grilled fresh pineapple, etc etc. Really packed full of fresh tastiness. For dessert we had the flan which was just OK, a bit too dense but flavorful. If you want a Mexico City taste, this is the place.

CtMy8KcARVE1_PdVIW9zOA.text: Whenever I have a craving for Mexican Food, this place satisfies.  Been eating here like 3-4 times in the last week.  The only downfall is that the food will slow you down for a few hours afterward but is worth it sometimes.  Dishes I love this week: plato de asada, beef burro (big burrito), lunch asada with rice and beans.  All fabulous!

N2G9gU-BORfkfSBvuF6Hbw.text: We've always had GREAT service here - the wait staff is extremely child-friendly. Our waiter the other night brought our daugter a cup of water with a pink umbrella in it and told her he made it special for her because she's a special little girl. Unbelievable! You just don't get that anymore in restaurants!  Anyway - we were seated immediately upon entering on a Friday night. Surprised the place wasn't more packed than it was... we've been here before and love their food.   Salsa was immediately brought to our table and we're big fans of their salsa. Simple, flavorful and authentic.   I almost always order the small Norteno Torta - I adore the flavor and texture combinations and their bolillo bread is so soft and fluffy and flavorful!  My little girl ordered the hamburguesa (or as she calls it, a hang-gubber). We each managed to sneak a bite of it - and it's a mighty fine burger indeed! I may one day try just a burger!  My husband asked our water to "go authentic" on him - he left his choice up to the waiter and our waiter did NOT disappoint. A plate full of seasoned beef, some nopales, rice and beans and fresh tortillas. He loved it.   Big fans - we'll go back again and again!

4jejjz1XM-W7-8yXOdnlvg.text: I've been here several times and in have to say the food is pretty good and the staff is very friendly. I've tried the Torta del Rey (about $9) and it is packed with meat, eggs, ham and many other yummy things that make it a gigantic Mexican sandwich.  I would split this with another person as it is big, unless of course you have lots of room for the entire yummy Torta.   I've also had the Carne Asada mini tacos ($5.99 for 3) served with cucumbers, lettuce and radish slices. These are good if you're not feeling extremely hungry.   There are many things on the menu including seafood and the regular burritos and typical Mexican dishes you would expect to find.  You MUST try the "aguas naturales" ($4) which are made with natural fruit right when you order them.  The strawberry and cantaloupe are my favorite.

pGumCm5RNTEN3mGTWp2Cgw.text: I've been here twice and have thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The restaurant is clean and staff is very friendly. They serve you chips and salsa while you wait for your food, but our meals were ready within 10 minutes! The portion size was also  very generous.The food was tasty and the staff always checked to make sure we were happy and our drinks were filled. My only wish is that they served alcoholic beverages. I will definitely be back!  Update: When I initially wrote my review it had just opened and they didn't have a liquor license yet. This place is great!

BhPpbq7F0Z5vIz8r9LyvnQ.text: Let's get to the good stuff, first... the chips were good.  My experience peaked there.  It certainly is a matter of taste, but the hot sauce they served with the chips, I found particularly disappointing.  Was looking forward to a good salsa, and I don't mean to play the definition game, but the sauce wasn't salsa...perhaps blame it on my American upbringing.  I ordered the enchilada's with the green sauce, and rice.  Again, may be personal taste, but I did not like the taste of the rice at all; totally could be "real" Mexican, but didn't dance well with my taste buds.  The enchiladas were bland, thankfully I still had some hot sauce from the chips to pour them.  What kind of ANY restaurant can last these days without serving alcohol?  What kind of ANY Mexican restaurant can survive these days without serving beer and a good margarita.  Knowing that a significant percentage of revenues for restaurants come from liquor and not the food, curious to know how long this place will last...  Anyway, for me, I was very disappointed.  Had gone there while I am in the area visiting because of the close proximity to where I'm staying and the reviews here on Yelp, but this time, wish I had gone with TravelAdvisor instead!

mpO3tQ_oxtmLicY3FczXHg.text: Awesome food. Love this place. I would recommend you give them a chance. I have been to the one in Phoenix and a buddy of mine told me to try tis one out and I was glad I did.

p_753x5mQ1d1C9spSEQttg.text: Good Tortas...a tad bit on the expensive side. Quick service and excellent traditional Mexican drinks.

m00ZsesoDIT-PRoKwIrd_g.text: Good Mexican food at a fair price.  Very authentic.  I went here with my parents and they loved it.  We had burritos, quesadilla, tacos, and tortas.  All were delicious.  Menu is friendly and lets you know what is in there, don't be afraid to ask for them to hold something out for you.  They cook each meal to order.  Food comes out hot and tasty.  I will definitely be back.

Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Quesadilla with carne asada

zHIO4xC3ps_V6NVQNf8Uqg.text: This was a very large disappointment. Went because I saw the restaurant on Man v. Food and therefore assumed this would be a great experience. Wasn't busy when I went, got seated immediately.   Soon after the chips and salsa came, but they came in such small dishes that we ran out quick, very annoying to have to wait whenever salsa came. Also, they told me that they didn't have a spicier salsa, WHAT THE FROCK!? They don't serve alcohol, which isn't why I give them 2 stars but still disappointing cause I wanted a margarita with my torta.   Ordered the torta del Rey, again cause it was on mvf. When it came out it was delicious but it came with potato chips! Mexican restaurant serving me ruffles, you have got to be kidding me. They get two stars cause it wasn't authentic, and could have gotten much better Mexican food somewhere else.

UKMRbnM_njk_TWKvhCR54A.text: Family friendly with delicious food! 4 stars only because I really wish they served margaritas!

JAj_YV19MwWyK70Gz0n4ZA.text: I'll keep it short and try and be sweet ...  Food is OK... fruit drinks are so not worth the price (all foam) Service is good This place is overrated....  So not worth the hype! Remember folks not everything on TV is good.

rIXnStVURBbq0HfXSKIaqQ.text: Authentic mexican food the kind of place you bring someone from out of town to show them what it's all about. The drinks are amazing as well.

ii1xds1yEmpJUI_hwCx8pg.text: Great tasting menudo chilaquiles and tortas !  Had the horchata and mixed juices. Tasty food three thumbs up

aInJsQcVmgy_O3Kd8-ZlbQ.text: my biggest complaint was how long it took for the delivery followed by the fact that the food was cold.  I really just want to blame the driver and I am sorry I tipped him in advance.  I am not going to try them for delivery again.

H9mUaDlXKVq2_g2U0WsowQ.text: Authentic and delicious. The service is great, the food is fantastic, casual and fun atmosphere. We love coming here. Their chips and salsa are addicting, all the tortas are incredible, the tacos are bomb, and it's all very reasonably priced. Our tab for the two of us is typically around $20, which is honestly a steal for the portion sizes and how great the food is.

6Kx0NRbOVhjTrq7LTlqJjA.text: Landed in PHOENIX on a Friday night . Needed a place to take my family that had good food and was  family friendly but also stayed open past 9pm. This place nailed it! Service was on point. Our waiter had patience with our difficult family and the ridiculous orders we placed. The food was excellent. The fresh juices and authentic Mexican food left us in a good mood and 100% satisfied. Definitely would go back, and surely would recommend .

oETKf2zEc_EDX2ioYMICDw.text: A little insight on the hater reviews I read, please never, ever, ever, compare Taco Bell to any real Mexican restaurant, if you eat that garbage, you do not deserve to eat real Mexican food, as your pallet is used to cheddar cheese on everything and can only like hamburgers, pizzas and hot dogs. Cheddar cheese is nowhere to be found in Mexico except in Mcdonalds and Burger King hamburgers. Don't order to go from an actual restaurant, you wouldn't go to Donovan's and order a steak to go, would you???? Go with time or don't go at all. If you have a service dog, provide proper documentation for it, so that they actually believe you (real service dogs usually have cute vests saying that, and don't pet me signs). Leave the chips alone, they serve huge amounts of food and it will be a waste of food to eat the chips vs the actual food. If you are a vegetarian there is a Sprouts farmers market in the same parking lot, go there and order a glutton free kale sandwich, you have no business going to restaurants unless its True Foods. On the positive: the food is great and as authentic as you can get here in Az. I can only say that for maybe 2 other places in the entire Maricopa county. Huge portions, order wisely. Service is better at the Phoenix location because they need to turn over those tables every second, because of limited spacing. Price very reasonable compared to portions served.

UOafCU29JgPmKhEOJILJiQ.text: LOS REYES THE LA TORTA OPENED UP A LOCATION IN TEMPE AND IT IS AS GOOD IF NOT BETTER THAN THE ORIGINAL!!! Tempe just hit the jack pot, growing up in north Phoenix I loved Los Reyes and I was happy to see that they opened one up here, I was a bit skeptical to try it since I thought it would lose its authenticity but it is even better tasting and the location surpasses the original by a lot! Very great authentic tortas from Mexico City with a great environment and even the other menu items other than tortas are great, one of the best original Mexican food places in Tempe that contain real Mexican foods!

ObAHuM8Uq5a9OsaTsZLL_A.text: Being that we were the only gringos in the joint was a good sign for me - this is where mexicans go for mexican food! Prices were reasonable, service was immediate and continuous (refills on water, chips, salsa,etc.) our server was very sweet, even took a photo for our group. The Hot salsa was muy picante - the house salsa was delicious and I wish I could get it at the store. The atmosphere was a bit noisy-sportsbar-ish, but I came for the food and was very pleased. We had Chicken Enchiladas, Tacos Camarones, and Tongue Tacos (no kidding...) and it was all very authentic and tasty. I will likely return if I'm in the Tempe area again with hungry friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. You know you like chicken enchiladas, that is why you are drooling.
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. more tacos, make your mouth go boom-boom!
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. shrimp tacos, so delicious you not belief!

Uz_V-MkoXJ3-c7OG09fkCw.text: Location, cleanliness, and service wise this place is great. The food itself? Nothing too special. We had visited this place a few months back and the service sucked so bad I vowed never to return. . only to be convinced to do so again. It seems the staff was upgraded and management really stepped up their game. But it all goes back to the food, nothing too outstanding, just your typical Mexican chain restaurant,

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Virgin drink and guac.

__REPdaT49z7nXU5iil1ZA.text: Originally came in because we heard it was good from a friend. Planned on getting a breakfast burrito to go. Tony convinced us to stay and have a seat. Aguas frescas are beautiful and delicious and the food was great! Glad we stayed! Very friendly environment. Great place! Thank you!

n9GNDACuDd3LjwVP0aNicw.text: Serious amazing food!!! Everything was super fresh and delicious...I've never had Mexican food like it! Heads up though...they do not serve alcohol, but regardless their list of agua frescas is amazing and all made with fresh fruit.

oDrJb0vTkvsK6H0jA8K4nQ.text: Great tasting Tortas at a great price. We will marking this place for a return trip even though it's far from home. The service was great and staff was super friendly.

EfMF3QjlPL261sQSGCTfww.text: Never have I seen such a variety of meat piled into one sandwich. The Del Rey torta certainly lives up to its name as does this restaurant. Just don't show up expecting to get a giant margarita to go with your giant Torta, they don't serve alcohol here. The only disappointment on an otherwise fantastic eatery.

vWOc_cNhSSTZW-CH66E4KA.text: My party of 3 adults and 3 kids ordered the chicken burro, red chicken enchilada, scrambled eggs with ham and a beef patty (?) we all cleaned our plates . Very friendly service. Clean interior. But their apple juice looked like diluted applesauce so my kids didn't finish theirs but we'd still return. Very reasonable prices.

iyxQBknThx1pinif8ccCXA.text: Margaritas have no alcohol in them - and you are seriously still charging over $5?  The tortilla chips and salsa were the tastiest part of the meal.  The service was very efficient and friendly but the waiter had a thick accent that was hard to understand.  I ordered the torta with steak, guacamole and sauce on the side.  The bread was the worst torta bread I ever had.  Doughy and white and not grilled.  The steak was flavorless.  The guacamole was to thin - would have preferred big chunks of avocado and the sauce wasn't good either.  My sandwich was served with Ruffles potato chips!  Yuck!  Friend ordered the carne asada mini tacos and wasn't that impressed either.  Hers looked better than mine though!

7i7lIJhcSHSRG_CXb8aDDg.text: Who would have thought Arizona would have such yummy Mexican food ? I am from California and it is pretty tough competition. This place was my first dinner in town and it did not dissapoint! I ordered a quesadilla de maiz with asada and wet style. Very large maize tortilla stuffed with cheese and asada and then topped with cheese and free sauce. I should have gotten a torta but maybe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States

L6M_i76Nmw-13kM-9eK6vQ.text: Highly recommend! Large menu with lots of options you won't be able to chose. I went with chicken tings sope and it was perfect. So many fun drink option- no alcohol served here but Agua Frescas of so many varieties. So many other things I wanted to try on the menu so we will be back soon

73CnPoYC9EbSD29GnEJqlg.text: This place is always on point you can never go wrong with the food and bomb ass drinks (mechiladas) here fresh authentic Mexican Food

Cjze94vt0ce5PrDmfCX8wQ.text: I've been passing by this place since it opened and just noticed that the food is Mexico City Style. So I had to try it.  It's not Americanized at all. Delicious food straight from the heart of Mexico.  The meal was fantastic and all I could have asked for. Home made Horchita, outstanding salsa that had real flavor with lots of depth. Guacamole that I could have eaten a gallon of. Much like mine. It's more than just a mashed up Avocado. And our meals were big but we finished them. This place is wonderful and worth the visit.  I'll be getting meals to go in the future since I drive right by it daily.

WwOWFjyr_nh1dzYeZfcWBw.text: If you're looking for authentic Mexican food with a super homey feel then this is your place. Awesome staff! Tony was super friendly and super personable it felt like I was being served by one of my own friends. They have an fantastic selection as well. I had the Tacos Azteca because how often do you get to try cactus? It was pretty damn  good. Great texture and had a lightly sour taste so it goes great with the side of beans and the house hot sauce. Here's the kicker; BYOB! They don't serve alcohol but they make delicious virgin drinks that you could spice up with some Tito's or Jose Cuervo. I think it's a huge plus that they let you byob! It's cheaper and you get to bring exactly what you want. Will not be my last time. LOVE IT.

tdzCLhcS9TPMgkRYxviYjQ.text: I've had this place on my wish list for quite a long time and today it was fulfilled! Holy Moley!!! It was AMAZING! Huge menu... Had to get a tortas. I had the Hawaiian Torta- it was savory, cheesy, spicy & sweet, and just plain delicious!! My friend had the Del Rey- it was ENORMOUS! These Tortas are like a party of flavor in each bite. Service was great, too. Highly recommended- 2 thumbs up!!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Torta- so good!!!!

ggg_Z-My-xFkE8eFjfvkEg.text: Talk about the most underwhelming restaurant visit of the year. My boyfriend and I saw that this was mentioned on Man vs. Food and we're immediately intrigued as it is located so close to our house. (Afterwards we found out that the show was centered around a different location. Not sure if that would've made a difference)   Immediately, we were surprised that a Mexican restaurant did not serve alcohol. They had such a pretty drink menu but apparently they were nonalcoholic. So strange.  Then we ordered chips and queso but it ended up being queso fresco, which, was just strange.   We then ordered the tortas mentioned on the show and were severely underwhelmed. Most Mexican food is soaked in spices and this tasted SO bland and flavorless.   The servers were kind but I wouldn't return here as there are SO many other spots with better food than this.

xfnKoZPcHuhlalqXNuYdNQ.text: Everything was fast fresh hot authentic and really good. Service was kind and attentive. Owners are from Mexico City- quinine is Southern Mexico.

eF7-6mwJrGoyw9X7NKlUgQ.text: My wife and I are hailing to the Kings.  This place specializes in Mexico City cooking, and in particular, the torta sandwich.  LOTS of different kinds of tortas  My wife and I are vegetarians, and generally do not eat tortas.  However, there are a variety of other dishes here that will keep us coming back.  BIG portions!  CHEAP!  They don't serve enchiladas or chile rellenos, but they do have great burritos with a distinct flavor.  Their chocoflan also makes a fantastic sweet end to a meal.  If you're looking for authentic Mexico City flavor, this is the place and the locals know it.  Service is generally friendly, the place is clean, and there is always futbol on the television when you sit down.  Highly recommended.  Los Reyes de la Torta:  GOOOOOOOOOOOAL!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States

nFhhL1ht11NlVKXIWjJ3gg.text: Dropped in again for my favorite; Quesadilla de maiz with bistec!  This is an amazing fish - especially after I've had a couple baskets if their chips & salsa but make sure you ask for the hotter salsa.  One of my favorite Mexican food restaurants.

yHLMGBMRbtcnGwEHrwqkoQ.text: I was excited to see a vegetarian section on the menu. The cactus tacos and veggie torta were delicious. Beans were good too! Plenty of warm chips and salsa. They have an extensive drink menu with juices and blended fruit drinks, but I was a little disappointed to find they don't serve alcohol since we found them by googling "margaritas in Tempe." Food was good enough to try again!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. The food was good! No alcohol :-(

lUjehJuLguw6NujkA5vXGw.text: To be honest I'm shocked by all of the 5 star reviews. My husband and I brought a family member from out of town here. We spent 75 bucks, didn't order any seafood or alcohol. The food is mediocre not terrible and the service was TERRIBLE. Like it was 3 of us, our server walked off before my husband could order. Then our food took forever yet it was kinda cold, that probably didnt help the taste, since the hot dog in my husbands torta was cold. The waitresses were more busy gossiping than checking in on us or refilling our drinks. The restaurant wasn't that busy to have been neglected like that. We were so embarrassed with our guest. We were trying to act cool but finally our family member said something in his super polite way. We will never ever be back. Sucks because i had high hopes.

4-aHaRLsvIdvMgXTiZaSPA.text: Have been wanting to try this place since I first came to Phoenix, 4 years ago.  Well, it was okay. After all this stuff I heard about these Reyes places, I must have had too high of expectations. I got enchiladas and a gordita; the enchiladas were standard Mexican restaurant fare. The gordita was, as well, but they went crazy with the cilantro so it was pretty bitter. Not having salt on the tables was annoying, speaking of that. The wife got one of the quesadillas de maiz, and it had a pretty generous meat portion; so, that was cool.  Atmosphere is typical casual Mexican restaurant (soccer on TVs, orange/brown-hued walls with generic "Mexicanish" things like sombrero-wearing dolls), but there are actual Mexican patrons in there; so that's a one-up for the authenticity, I reckon.

QJH7SBxCG1jnnFL2HOCH_g.text: this is a legit mexican food restaurant !!  Jaquie is the best!!:) we always look for good mexican food and torta king has best food and great service

cFLxTmkW6MlOTVc_MII0RQ.text: In a city shrouded in the darkness of a lack of authentic Mexican food Los Reyes de la Torta is a beacon of light, hope and free freshly made chips.   It's big and clean - great place for families. It's kind of unique because places this good and authentic are usually dirty little hole-in-the-wall-shopping-plaza-restaurants. But this place is in a free standing building with plenty of seating and booths!   They have free chips and salsa. It's spicy salsa too. Clearly not made for white people. Also, my family were the only white people in there at the time. So ya know it's good.   Service was great. Plenty of parking. Oh and the menu is HUGE. it's kind of overwhelming but they have vegetarian and fish options, so it's a great place for pescatarians.

Jhd1BCBPImPSZXvYQa6Kiw.text: Awful server, he messed up several times, brought the wrong drink and got mad at me, plus he was trying to oversell a larger plate for my daughter. He then brought me the larger plate even though I asked for the small one. I've been a client since 2013, but after this I'm not coming back here, after all, there are many other options in the valley to go spend my money.

93CkGlMXiRqgpGY66Cxxdg.text: Overall, good service.  Our server was patient and offered guidance in making my decision. This evening the restaurant was fairly empty except for the large party that was there celebrating a child's (?) Birthday. After we finally decided on what we were having and ordered I realized they actually close fairly early.  Eight p.m. seems like an early hour to close. Our dinners were delivered moments after our beverages had been dropped off and they looked so good.  Mmm.  One of the items delivered was actually not what had been ordered.  She brought two (2) of the Tortas del Ray and one was a tally supposed to be an omelette.   It was discussed and then decided it would be consumed instead of sending it back and waiting for the correct entree to be made . All of it was tasty. And it was just too much.   So of course we had to split the Esquimo.  I honestly can't recommend one thing because the few times I've dined here I've always had something different and they've all been really good. So I would suggest you be adventurous, try something new.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Esquimos chocolate
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chura...  I don&#39;t remember.  It&#39;s basically pork tacos.
Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Torta del Ray

XYqzYwPVdSCLi_FOaBfkWQ.text: The best authentic Mexican Food in Tempe!   I ordered the shrimp ceviche Tostadas and the Carne Asada Quesadilla de Maiz with Green sauce and cream.  Absolutely delicious!  This is a little hidden gem!

b7labiQjzP6625uIhZV3DQ.text: This place is delicious! I never write reviews on anything; however, this establishment deserves the recognition. From the welcoming presence, to the friendly and efficient service, to the quality of food, cleanliness of the restaurant, the inviting atmosphere, and prices are all terrific...  My fiance and I decided to give Los Reyes a try a little over a month ago. The parking lot didn't look very busy, but as we entered the restaurant we were pleasantly surprised to find that it was packed with predominantly Hispanic patrons (always a good sign in a Mexican restaurant). Everyone appeared to be having a good experience at each table as we walked by; which, set the tone.   As we were being seated, we noticed servers walking by with trays of food, all the dishes had beautiful presentation. There was authentic Mexican music playing, informative and friendly staff to match. As we opened the menus, we noticed that Los Reyes was featured on Man vs. Food; which, was also another good sign.   Tony was our server, who came over promptly, welcomed us, then gave us the run down of house favorites and what Los Reyes is best known for. He was very accommodating, social and aware of our needs. Great service from him and all who we had interface with each time. Tony shared the history of the restaurant and expressed his gratitude for being a part of the family.   The food is extremely flavorful authentic style Mexican from (Mexico City) with perfect portions and affordably priced. We thoroughly enjoyed our time from start to finish and kept observing how well we felt we were taken care of there. I can't speak highly enough about our experiences here! We've visited four times in the last month and a half and will definitely return. The place is impeccable!

0JDeUqvdJJ9CeUY3uBPenA.text: I have kept coming here over and over and I always get something delicious. My husband and my three kids love it. I have told friends to come here and they have never been disappointed. The cabeza, and carne asada tacos are my favorites. however almost any torta is good too. My kids love the sincronizada and the carne asada platters too. I always order the toreado chiles and the onions as a side with whatever I order because they are so good. I have tried sopes, huaraches,tostadas,tacos and tortas and I have never been disappointed. Don't forget to ask for the picante salsa they make but only give you if you ask. Is spicy but very good!. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Reyes De La Torta - Tempe, AZ, United States. Look for the sign!
